Reviews.Title: “A Short Trip”
Reviews.Author: v11rah Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Went to Amsterdam to see a rock band at the Melkweg. Booked this hotel, it was very near and was also near to restaurants and bars. Its location is away from the noise and the rooms were bigger than most in Amsterdam that I have stayed in in the past. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and kindly”
Reviews.Author: paolo t Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: they were so good tu us We spent there only one night. room was very comfortable and clean. the location was a little bit far from the center.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: David200870
Reviews.Content: As previous review - no hot water for a complete day and management did not see this as a problem. We also wandered what the superior room was superior to - glad we did not stay in the normal room! During our stay at the hotel my dog was staying in far better conditions. Location was good though. If it was 10 euros a night i would say it was fair value. Would not stay there again unless I was paid to. A good, customer focussed manager could easily make this a good hotel to stay in. Unfortunately that is not what they have got. Very very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Disapppointing”
Reviews.Author: susan n Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although we had booked a superior double room, it was quite small and dark. The gable at one end of the room meant we had to keep ducking to avoid banging our heads on the low ceiling. There was no hot water on the one day of our stay. The first breakfast we had there was totally disorganised-no clean plates and tables not cleared although it was much better the second day. I don't think I would stay there again, although the location is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hale44
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome awaits everyone who chooses the Leidse Square Hotel. Rooms are clean, warm and comfortable and reasonably sized. There is an excellent en suite with shower and wall-mounted hairdryer. Towels were fresh daily. Our room on the second floor overlooked gardens at the back of the hotel and was lovely and quiet to relax in especially after a lot of walking and museum sight-seeing. An important point in our choice of hotel was a lift. Many converted houses have steep stairs with no lift. I had stayed close by at the other side of VondelPark on an earlier visit and had realised a lift for older people is essential. It certainly made a difference to our stay. It was though an excellent choice. Staff were warm and friendly and really helpful. There was good tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. The computer in reception is slow but perfectly usable for a short stay. Breakfast was adequate with both hot and cold choices. My only suggestion would be to have tea and coffee available for guests in the reception area where peoploe can sit and chat or while waiting for rooms or to return to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Got lucky”
Reviews.Author: eded2005
Reviews.Content: Got a room on the 4th floor, these seem to be the nicest -- quite large and normal for Amsterdan standards...Excellent bed and shower, very calm location and near everything turistic. The bar man is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pearl Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: munchkin59
Reviews.Content: This hoyrl has a really good position for Amsterdam. Close to the centre but quiet. The staff were helpful, the breakfast was good and the rooms were good for a central location

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: newtraveller45
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at this hotel - and was seriously impressed. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, room was spacious, clean and comfortable. TV, hairdryer, kettle and a safe. The location is ideal - 5 mins walk from the trams etc.Van Gogh museum is approx 15 mins walk and Vondel Park approx. 5 mins walk. Bike hire is 15 euros for 24 hours which again is good value. The buffet breakfast was lovely - plenty of variety and no hassle. Again, the staff were really friendly and helpful. I would definately return and would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted, the perfect weekend escape.”
Reviews.Author: IanMacDonald1961
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly & efficient, the room - p'haps a tad too snuggly - was comfortable, the bed superb & the shower near perfect. The hotel is a stone's throw from tram, bus & taxi stops (bus takes 1/2 an hour from hotel to airport) & a 3 min walk to the lively Leidseplein area. Due to it's location - one very small block back from the main roads- the hotel is very quiet & relaxed. An ideal spot to rest your head & body after a night out in town. We will definitely use this hotel again. Thank you for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: gorgee6
Reviews.Content: The location: Nestled in a quiet tree lined street, yet only a few minutes away from Leidse Square, its shops, tourist office, restaurants, airport bus, all trams, and the main museums. Absolutely ideal and perfect location. The hotel: clean, small rooms, yet very comfortable beds. Excellent shower pressure with scolding hot water! A bonus in Europe! The service @ the front desk was always friendly and helpful. We had breakfast each morning (not included in the room rate, but very reasonable and much cheaper than an outside breakfast). It was an all you can eat style- different types of bread, eggs, cheese, bacon, cold cuts/ jams/jellies, juices and teas/coffee- I highly recommend having breakfast daily from the hotel. We stayed on the 3rd floor - 307 - and it was nice and quiet, with a pretty view of the street and trees. I highly recommend this hotel- location can't be beat, the price is right, and for a 3 star rating, it has more than what you would expect for a hotel in this class. The Mariott was just down the street, and for double the price, its not worth it when you get a great deal @ the Best Western Leidse Square! Try it!

Reviews.Title: “my new amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: coramper
Reviews.Content: clean. great location. good service. good breakast, a deal at 7.5 euros if you book the day before. great small bar. barman zidah is a wonderful and informative man. there are many hotels in amsterdam, but i will return to this one probably because of him. all the other staff is stellar as well, but he especially shines.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: RaffaelHodHasharon
Reviews.Content: The Best Western at Leidse Sq. in Amsterdam is a nice, pleasent hotel in a very good location in Amstrerdam within a walking distance to almost all of the attractions in the city. The staff were very helpfull and our room was modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: fairy_nic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my boyfriend and we had a great time! The hotel is in a lovely, quiet neighbourhood but is just a 5 minute walk from Leidse Square where there are lots of cafes, restaurants and bars if you are going for a romantic weekend away rather than on a stag/hen party i would recommend to stay in leidse square! The hotel is clean and the room we had was big with a nice bathroom although we didn't have a double bed it was 2 singles pushed together! The staff were friendly and helpful and I would recommend the breakfast its 7.5 euros for an eat all you can eat buffet and there is a choice of hot as well as cold food along with the usual breads, croissants, fuits and cereals. We ate out for breakfast the first morning and found that it was cheaper to just eat in the hotel for breakfast. Whilst in Amsterdam we visited the Anne frank museum which was really interesting, the sex museum which was actually quite good as well as a laugh and at 4 euros it is worth a visit! we also took a canal boat trip which was only 10 euros and was a nice way to see all of the city! The red light district is also a must at night time when it is busier and you still feel safe even though it is night time. Food and drink are quiet expensive but we found that it was the same in most places although we did find some italians where all main meals were only 5 euros we tried one out and it was nice! When getting the train from the airport to centraal station make sure you get on the right train as we ended up on the wrong one with alot of other people as well, because a women who worked at the train station told us the wrong information! Not all of the trains going from the stops they tell you to go to are all going to centraal station so make sure you check! Also beware of bikes people ride around on them everywhere and they don't stop for anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidNewcastleUK
Reviews.Content: Arrived via the Bus #197 outside Amsterdam Airport which dropped us off at Leidseplein which was about 3-5 minutes walk depending on the time of day.The bus was 4 Euro for adults and far more reasonable then a taxi which costs around 39 Euro.The hotel was Clean Welcoming on Entrance and the staff are excellent and Speak outstanding English.Breakfast is 7.50 Euro which consists of Bacon,eggs, Croissants,Cereals, Yoghurt and is a self service which you can have as much to eat as you like.Its great quality food and the breakfast room is large and also cleaned to a high standard. The hotel Staff are always willing to help if you ask them questions about where to buy stamps,how to get to and from the centre they will give you very straight forward directions and a free map.The rijks museum is right around the corner about 5 minutes walk and well worth the trip we visited the Torture museum which was kind of mediocre and not really worth it.The sex Museum is decent and worth the money also I realise the ladies in the window are kind of off putting for some people however there is really decent bars,Restaurants in this area.The Prostitutes and Pot heads are only one part of Amsterdam the Red Light district is something that needs to be experienced its a bit of a shock however kind of makes you laugh too, me and my girlfriend found it rather hilarious.The hotel is about 40 minutes walk to this area however Unless you are disabled or fat and lazy then I would suggest walking everywhere if you can as you can explore all the side streets and really see some beautiful buildings. The canal Tour is well worth it and the hotel give you a 10% Discount card which does make a difference.The rooms in the hotel are spacious with free tea/Coffee and it is cleaned every morning by some wonderful cleaning staff.The towels are replaced if you use them be sure to leave them on the bathroom floor if you need new ones. The hotel offers an outstanding Location and Excellent staff I honestly couldn't fault them in any way.If I visit Amsterdam I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Central position, good service”
Reviews.Author: Claido
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect position: 10 min walking from the old area + very well connected thanks to the frequent trams. The room was small but very clean and the people were helpful and friendly. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Physic77
Reviews.Content: The first thing to know about the Best Western Leidse square is it's well located, really well located in fact. You're a few minutes stroll from the Leidseplein, a few minutes stroll from the Vondelpark, and not much more than that from the various rather wonderful museums Amsterdam has to offer. I stayed in a single room, it was compact to the point of being rather reminiscent of some university accommodation - a bathroom, a bed a couple of desks and sufficient room to move between them. The bed was adequately sized, I'm 6'2" and it fitted me comfortably, if you're much larger than that you might find it a little cramped mind. That said the room was well designed so as to fit in the essentials in a way that despite the size of the room didn't feel too crowded. The bathroom was the standout feature, again not large but clean, modern and well maintained. The staff were very friendly and helpful as well, if you use the shuttle bus from the airport to get to the hotel (strongly recommended at 23 euro's for a return, compared to 39 euros each way for a taxi) they'll book your return journey for you if you ask. By no means a luxury hotel, but for the price highly recommended if what you want is somewhere clean, comfortable and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room in a Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Marcasso
Reviews.Content: It's located a few blocks from Leidse Square. Look for it on the satellite imaging of google before going there. We had to wait over an hour past checkin to get our room. I got the room with three beds even though there were only two of us. I've stayed in Amsterdam many a time and the rooms were always so small so I thought it would be bigger this way. And it was! Although it was in a part of the hotel where there is no lift, we had to down stairs...i thought we were in the basement! We walked by a area where there were workers doing stuff ( i think laundry or dishes?). I'm getting madder and madder now. We get all the way to the end of the hallway and go in to a very dark room...i think "ok...we're in the basement". I open the curtains and voila! We had one of the very few rooms with double doors leading out to the center yard in the back of the hotel. The third bed was in a little room between the bathroom and the main room. So the room ended up being ok. Wish we had stayed closer in town though. It had it's ups and downs. Quiet and peaceful was nice. Distance from everything not so great. Breakfast was good...but we only ate there once.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room!”
Reviews.Author: SimoneBee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic location with great access to trams and buses. It was a short walk to the main shopping and restaurant street and the Winter Festival that was being held! It was fantastic. Our room was huge by most European standards, we were in a quad room on the lower floor with a massive window and lots of space. The staff were nice and the breakfast was good. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: STANDS_OUT
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st visit to Amsterdam. We stayed 2 weeks before Christmas for 3 nights. I found a great package through an on-line travel agent that worked out cheaper than booking seperate flights and hotel. We were approx Â£350 for both of us all-in. Bargain! The hotel was lovely. Brilliant value for money. It has really friendly staff who allowed us to check in 3 hours early! This was wonderful as it meant we had 4 full days to explore. We were also able to leave our luggage in a secure room when we checked out as we had late night flights home too. The room was perfect for a short stay. It had fantastic central heating (it was freezing outside!), a lovely big window that opened overlooking the hotel across the street, a large wardrobe with a safe, comfortable bed and a clean brightly lit bathroom. The room was cleaned each day.The room was fairly small but perfect for a couple for a short stay. Afterall we weren't visiting to spend a lot of time in the room. We had breakfast the 1st morning in the hotel, it wasn't for me. The hot-food had gone cold and the breakfast room could do with maybe the radio playing or something to give it a bit more atmosphere. Everyone was eating in silence! Very strange for me! There was plenty of choice and everyone else seemed happy. Luckily we stayed room-only. I may have felt I'd been ripped off if I'd paid extra for B&B as there are so many lovely places to eat out for breakfast. There is also a lovely little bar in the hotel which was great to come back to after a night out for a meal etc. It was no more expensive than any other bar which was great. The bar man was very friendly too. The location of the hotel is brilliant. If I were to visit Amsterdam again, I would look this hotel up before booking anywhere else. Brilliant value for money restaurants near by, a short walk to the Van Gough Museum, the Fashion District right round the corner, Great tram links for everywhere you may want to visit. For me it was the perfect hotel for a Christmas break. We are considering coming back in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Leidse Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anette H
Reviews.Content: There were supposed to be a safe in every room. I guess we got the one without, so we had to leave all our "valuables" in the front desk safe, where we only could access it at certain times. Accept from that the hotel was average. Short walk to leidseplein.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location.”
Reviews.Author: Jayflynn19
Reviews.Content: Not a bad little hotel quite central for some of the main attractions. Breakfast was also very plentiful with a wide choice of hot and cold food. Room was a bit small though for Â£200 per night over the new year period, price halved from 2nd January. Overall I would stay again but not during a festival or holiday occasion because it is not worth it for the doubling in price against the facilities of the hotel. There are better hotels that cost less.

Reviews.Title: “Good / above average quality for a 'value' end room in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Nicky G
Reviews.Content: You seem to pay more than you would elsewhere for hotels in Amsterdam and then they turn out to feel â€˜wornâ€™ and a bit of a letdown. This was much better, and good for the price. You need to get a tram or a taxi from the Central Station (or itâ€™s a half hour walk), but trams are plentiful. Hotel is located in a quiet residential street about 5 minutes from the Leidsesplein which is a square with off-roads with lots of bars, restaurants/cafes, and ideal for the Melkweg which is just off the square. Check-in/reception staff were helpful and efficient. Rooms are pleasant, tastefully furnished, and have either been well-cared for or were newly restored. Rooms are not large - might get a bit claustrophobic if staying more than one night â€“ probably because much like others the hotel is conversion and so reflects the original layout of the property. Didnâ€™t have breakfast but it looked good and there was a small but comfortable lobby area which was comfortable to wait for/meet people in.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: Orchman
Reviews.Content: Four of us spent a long weekend in Amsterdam and this hotel was a suitable base for our stay. Being a franchise you expect certain standards and we were not disappointed with our choice. The rooms were a decent size with one facing the street (107) and the other facing the rear (104). The room facing the rear was quiet whereas the one at the front did suffer a bit from street noise in the early hours as people returned from their eveing out. The rooms had twin beds and were very clean. Digital safe, towels and hairdryers were supplied as well as TV and tea making facilities. Breakfast was ok. 7.50 euros in advance or 10 euros on the day for typical Continental style fare. For those in the UK this is very similar to the Premier Inn standard. The hotel is situated in a quiet area only a short walk from the bars and cafes of Leidse Square. A reasonably priced hotel which met all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kilese
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, a ten-minute walk from the museums, and a five-minute walk from a great shopping street. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was fine. Free wifi. Electric kettle with tea and coffee. The buffet breakfast was good and cheap if you reserved the night before (7.5 euros). This hotel is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: moselmeister
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for four days from 9th December to the 12th and had a great time. The hotel is close to the 297 bus stop to and from Schippol airport â‚¬4 each way. The staff were friendly and rooms cleaned every day. If you get a chance you must have a walk through Vondel park, i would love to see it in summer and will do if we get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, adequate breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rsoxtim
Reviews.Content: The best asset by far for this hotel is its location - its easily walkable just about anywhere in the city, especially the museums. I stayed here for a night back in May 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff were extremely friendly with pointing out locations on maps. The room was adequate for a European single room - free wifi was great. The breakfast was adequate and since I'm not a picky breakfast person, I found it pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: wisteriagirl
Reviews.Content: What a great find! So close to the leidse spquare, where you can catch a tram to everywhere, walk to the other main attractions. Hotel is a part of very old victorian building, most helpful, friendly receptionists I have never came across in my hotel experience. The room and bed was very comfy, great big window facing to the court yards. Bathroom spottlessly clean, very powerfull shower. Had a kettle, so I didn't have to take mine, but make sure to bring your own tea bags if you are a tea person! Also bring your own milk, or buy one from the supermarket nearby. My friend bought a cheese to take home, but the reception kindly take it to their fridge until we require. Breakfast was great, you can have it for 7.50 if you book in advance the night before. So close to the park we took morning strolls every day.Thank You for the lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: AnnieRussia
Reviews.Content: Very near to Rijksmuseum (be careful, half of it is closed till 2013 for repair), to Leidseplein with bars, to channels with excursion boats.Nearby is a quiet park. Ypu can have a breakfast at EUR 7,50, it is not bad and includes eggs, juices, yoghurts, bread-jams,muesli,omlette with bacon, mushrooms,tomatoes. The rooms are dark and small.Safe box is free of charge as well kettle and tea bags.There is no main light in room so you'll have to switch on some small lamps. TV has channels only in dutch, only one is CNN.The hotel is quite old, the shower cabin is very ver very small,I'm a slim person anyway it was difficult for me to move!

Reviews.Title: “a lovely city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: stuart_linda
Reviews.Content: One of the better city hotel I have stayed at, clean roomy comfortable, helpful staff. Breakfast good only down side was the cooked scambled eggs, bacon and mushrooms were luke warm but still enjoyable. Staff recommended two good places to eat a store called V&D near the flower market, and a restaurant called pachuis in voetboogstraat near the flower market, just keep following the main throughfare down from leidse square towards the railway station. We wanted a basic place to eat and these fulfilled that, I'm sure there are other good places to eat, but we couldn't try them all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff & a great location.”
Reviews.Author: olivernone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of November after a problem with our original hotel booking at a sister hotel. The hotel has quite basic facilities but what it lacks in facilities is made up for by it's excellent staff & a location that is just fantastic for exploring this great city. The tram line to Dam Square is only 3 minutes walk from the hotel as is the bus stop, a bus from the airport for â‚¬4 was great value as opposed to â‚¬39 in a taxi. The lively Leidse Square, hard Rock Cafe are a 5 minute walk from the hotel while the Van Gogh museum, Heineken Brewery tour are within a 15 minute walk. This hotel is by no means luxury, breakfast was fine but there is no restaurant for lunch or daytime/evening snacks, it is exceptionally clean though & our room (17) on the ground floor was surprisingly big & we wern't bothered by street noise at all. The barman called Ziya was one of the most pleasent, helpful barmen we have ever met, as were all of the hotel staff

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: AllyBally3
Reviews.Content: A stones throw from Leidse Square and next door to the Vondel Park. Very Clean, nice staff, excellent breakfast. We were upgraded because of a mix up in bookings, so our room was faultless. Unable to comment on basic rooms, but think they would be of a good standard. It was a pleasant surprise to find it so quiet, being so close to the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: AndyB1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Leidse Square Hotel for a weekend in October 2011. The staff we both friendly and helpful on check-in. The room itself was basic but clean. Rooms were quite expensive 350 Euro for 3 nights, without breakfast. Good location, just next to the Vondelpark behind the Marriott hotel . usually use priceline for Amsterdam hotels, but would return to this hotel again... not bad at all. Downside.... the Mattresses were really uncomfortable... like blamanche.... ( but not pink )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ShaznGraz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful; room was not the biggest but enough space and very, very clean. Bathroom was modern with a great shower. Breakfast was plentiful. Best thing was the location - within minutes walk of the Van Gogh Museum; the Hard Rock Bar; the Leidseplein and shops. We took a taxi from the train station - a bit of a sting at 20 Euro. There are many trams stopping close by but best way to get about is on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on a lovely avenue”
Reviews.Author: Robyn73
Reviews.Content: Next to Vondelpark and a short walk to bars, restaurants and Heineken Brewery. Lovely setting on a lovely avenue. Room was clean, staff were welcoming, breakfast room pleasant. Could not really fault this hotel. Would definitely stay again if I ever visited again but for me Amsterdam has priced itself right out of the market. Everywhere so expensive. One bar was 4.65 euros for half lager or 5.65 for a pint.

Reviews.Title: “We will do our best :(”
Reviews.Author: asiljr
Reviews.Content: Having read all the wonderful reviews, I decided to go ahead and book this hotel for two nights at the beginning of December. I specifically requested a quiet room, as one of the reviews said that it could get a bit noisy at night if the room overlooks the street. I guess I was a bit naiive to presume that one and a half months (I sent an email in mid October) is quite reasonable for such a request. In their reply the hotel advised me that they will do their best! Don't they know which rooms they have available? I didn't have any problems with booking another hotel though. The people there were quite happy to reserve a quiet room for us. I would like to stress again, that I haven't stayed in the hotel - and don't intend to - so my comments are only about the service I received while making reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy, comfortable -- and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hollholl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its price, its location, and amenities such as breakfast and free wireless Internet. I was not disappointed! I had booked a double occupancy room after reading that some of the rooms were very small, and was left wondering how small a single would be. My room (359) was fine for one person but two people staying in it would be completely in each other's way. Being on the top floor, the walls slanted inward part of the way up. This took away from the spaciousness of the room, but gave the room a cozy, homelike feel which was nice. Being able to hear the rain on the roof was also nice. And the room was on a corner so it had windows on two walls. There was a desk on one side of the bed with a TV on it, and a small but adequate closet near the door. The bed was super comfortable although the pillows were awkwardly big. The cable system offered a decent selection of English language channels (Discovery, National Geographic, CNN, BBC, TLC, Comedy Channel, and maybe a few others). The free wifi worked perfectly and there was no need to get new codes and/or re-log-in every day as at many hotels. The staff were quite friendly. The clerk working the front desk when I arrived sopping wet at 7 am got me a cup of coffee and (even better) got me a room an hour later. Another clerk was very helpful with restaurant and tram tips. This hotel is in a great part of Amsterdam -- near but not directly on lively Leidse Square, very close to Vondelpark which has a 2.5 mile running loop, and close to tram lines with direct connections to Centraal Station (lines 1, 2 and 5) and the RAI Center (line 12). The immediate neighborhood is quiet and residential, but even so my sleep was disturbed a couple of times by loud people walking by in the wee hours. All in all, this is not a luxury hotel, but it is very comfortable and I would happily stay there again during a future visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “WORST-EVER”
Reviews.Author: Fredasl
Reviews.Content: Absolutely horrible! We arrived to a tiny room w two twin beds pushed together instead of the real double bed we had rented. After waiting a long time and getting the song and dance about getting the room, we received the new room. Paper thin walls and doors. School of children slamming doors(enough to make mine rattle!!!!)! Didn't sleep that night, hotel told us they'd refund us for the now-cancelled second night and would offer us their breakfast if we stayed (seriously.). Then there was trouble getting the refund. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IainBrighton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel last night (18/10) and best to describe as functional. Arrived late (11.40pm) and was allocated Room 215 which seemed quite large with 2 double beds, but only needed a single. Room was cold but seemed ok in the morning. Breakfast was fine and good value for â‚¬7. Bill was steep at â‚¬145 for the night, including breakfast (pre-ordered for â‚¬7 on checking in). Overall, no complaints but recognise this is not a luxury hotel and the best way to describe it is 'Functional'. Good walk to the main train station which is about 20-25 mins but preferred this to just sitting on a tram.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephen Evans
Reviews.Content: Located about 3 blocks from Leidseplien this Best Western offers affordable accomodations. However, rooms on the ground and first floors facing the streets experience quite a bit of noise from pedestrians and vehicles. If you have a choice select a room that faces the courtyard in the rear of the hotel or a higher floor. The rooms we had (three of them) were uniformly small but that may be a reflection of the reduced rate we received. The beds are comfortable but it can be a challenge to find a place for your suitcases. The reception staff were accomodating and offered good advice for moving about Amsterdam. The breakfasts (fee) were very good, offering a range of foods from typical continental meats, cheeses and breads to eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - central location”
Reviews.Author: Josh1636
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night on a whistlestop break. We had room 360 which, though a little small, was perfectly sufficient. We were situated at the back of the hotel. We had a good nights sleep owing to the quiet setting, also what looked to be new mattresses (if not new were nearly new!). Good bathroom with basic toiletries and wall hanging hairdrier provided. Staff very friendly - main doors kept locked at night which is reassuring, though hotel is situated on a back street. We paid 75 euros for a buffet style breakfast - plenty of variety and kept replenished by the helpful staff. 24 hour reception which is useful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: teudatole
Reviews.Content: Just got back after 5 night stay. Very clean. Good breakfast. Friendly and helpfull staff. Ask for a room on the back for quiter sleep. Overall: will stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Top value and a great location”
Reviews.Author: chalkhill-blue
Reviews.Content: We paid just â‚¬65 for a double room for one night, booked a couple of days before travel. At that price it was terrific value for money. The hotel is in a quiet residential street very close to the city centre with good restaurants, trams and many of the main attractions within short walk. Our room quite small but adequate and spotlessly clean with a comfortable bed and a good bathroom. The staff are friendly and there's a good bar. Breakfast is good value at â‚¬7.5 Euros if you pay at check-in time (otherwise â‚¬10). Judging by some of the other reviews, not every room is as good as ours. But you can only go by your own experience and I would highly recommend the Best Western Leidse Square.

Reviews.Title: “functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: pixcell
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. When we arrived at the check - in desk the receptionist took great delight in letting us know that we had been giving a free upgrade ....... the room was very small and cramped so god only knows what the normal rooms are like!!! The beds were clean and comfortable and the shower was pretty powerful and always lots of hot water available. Location is fine although it could be noisey at night. Our room was 207 situated right above the Best Western sign at the front of the building and unfortunately all the smokers congregated just below us ... if you want a peaceful sleep - I would suggest you ask for a room looking out to the back of the hotel. Amsterdam is a wonderful city to visit and to be honest with you for all the time we spent at the hotel the room was perfectly functional.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing much.”
Reviews.Author: VacationOslo
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room for 4 nights. Upon arrival I was given room 210 facing the backyard, which was nice. The room had wall to wall carpet, which I found rather strange. There were no minibar in the room. There where no heating in the bathroom floor, making it very cold as there were tiles on the floor. The tv was very small and it was not a flat screen. Nice to see that the room had a safe. The staff was nice, however checking in took approx 15 minutes...very slow! The breakfast was very standard. Only scrambled eggs and bacon as hot dishes, which is quite ok for me. Being a Scandinavian I'm much more interested in the quality and freshness of the bread. The service was nice, however the breakfast lacked an atmosphere as there were not made any attempt making it a cosy place for eating breakfast. The area around the hotel was nice. The Vondelpark was nice. Getting to RAI congress centre took 15 minutes with tram number 12, excluding a 5 min walk to tram stop in both directions. Would stay there again, but you will not have any problems getti g a cheaper hotel in the same area for less money. The breakfast was 7,5 euros if ordered when checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauraemma
Reviews.Content: Returned from a weekend away to Amsterdam. The hotel was in a good location and in walking distance to bars and restaurants. We were allocated a room on the ground floor which was a single room with double bed, we went back to reception to complain and we were told we could change the next day. We were given complimentary breakfast for the whole of our stay for the inconvenience. We viewed the double room the following morning but decided to stay in the single room as the shower was more modern.The rooms are all different in this hotel as we discovered when visiting our friends rooms, so it's a bit hit and miss which room you end up with.We found it to be lovely and clean and the beds very comfortable. The staff were also Very nice on reception and helpful with our with our questions about Amsterdam. Although the hotel is nothing fancy it's nice for a weekend away. Questions about

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, well situated for city centre and museums”
Reviews.Author: Greytaunt
Reviews.Content: Situated in a quiet side-street near Leidse Plein, the hotel location was very convenient for exploring the city centre as well as for reaching the museums. Several tram routes served the immediate vicinity and a canal-bus mooring-place was also close by. Hotel staff members were friendly and competent, and the building itself appeared well looked-after, though the floors were rather uneven in places. A lift was available for guests. Our twin-bedded room was large enough for our needs and faced away from the street. Tea and coffee-making facilities were available and there was a safe in the room. The small bathroom was adequately equipped, including bathtub, shower and hair-dryer. The accommodation was very clean. The mattresses were rather soft but supported on a firm base. An extensive breakfast buffet was available at a cost 7.50 EUR per person per day if booked the previous evening. A small bar offered drinks in the evening at a reasonable price. For a city centre tourist hotel we have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: tonyncaf
Reviews.Content: Hi just got back from three good days in the Dam. Best western not a bad hotel. breakfast continental, plenty for all and nice and clean. Hotel situated behind the Marriat near leidse square. rooms ok with the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in. staff ok friendly enough. Would reccomend this hotel to anyone wanting a quick cheap break. Out and about, Dont drink in the Euro bar in the square 37 euros for four drinks ha. Eat ribs 10 euros as much as you can,nice. Also wok to walk good value and quite tasty. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We were given a non air-conditioned room due to error by our booking agent. They changed us to an air-conditioned room for an additional 10 Euros per night. Hotel staff were friendly & helpful. Beds were small and not comfortable according to american standards. Continental breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: koraye
Reviews.Content: Free Internet it's fast? 3-star hotel. No minibar in the room. A few tram stops to Central Station? Smoking is not allowed inside. No restaurant in the hotel but many dining places in 3-5 min walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Average , small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mate0517
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at the Leidse Square. The location was great. We walked everywhere. The rooms we had were extremely small. I understand rooms in Europe are small, however, I've been to a number of places in Europe and these were the smallest rooms we've had anywhere. You could barely walk around the bed to the bathroom. Also, the closet couldn't fully open because it was blocked by the bed. Also, when we arrived, they input the wrong rates for us. They were higher than what I confirmed on line. That was an extra hassle that we had to work through on check in.

Reviews.Title: “Good American Style Hotel in a European City”
Reviews.Author: Daddy_R
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Amsterdam in August of 2010. I ended up paying $341.14 with tax and everything for two nights at the hotel. I was given a room in basement to which I complained about because I thought I didn't want to be in the basement. Turns out my basement room was larger than the room I was given on the 2nd floor. Also, the basement room was more easily accessible than the room on the 2nd floor. Even though their was an elevator on the second floor I still had to walk up some stairs to get to my room. A little inconvenient with all the luggage I had. My other complaint was that for what I paid breakfast was not included. Lastly, service was ok. Most of the receptionist were cool. But I remember one lady in particular gave me major attitude. Overall, I probably would not stay there again but only because when I travel back to Amsterdam I want to stay in a different part of town. Other than that I would definitely stay again. I waited until I got to Amsterdam to find a hotel. I doing so I visited a couple other places. Hostels and Hotels. For the price and convenience this place was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NEARLY PERFECT!!”
Reviews.Author: Louise G
Reviews.Content: We'd stay at the Leidse Square Hotel again in a heartbeat! The location was fantastic - close to everything. We're not exactly young and walked from here to the Palace and everywhere inbetween. Could have taken public transportation but prefered to walk. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we didn't visit a lot of tourist sites prefering to discover the city. However we will return and we definitely will stay at this hotel again. The room was clean. The breakfast was good considereing it wasn't a restaurant, and it was plentiful. The two barmen we met were great company. Very informative and humourous. Desk staff were professional - all but one lady who was a bit phony and insincere. Coffee/tea/milk were not replaced each day but desk staff happy to give us lots more when asked. Room was small but we only slept in it! The bed was very very comfortable. Noise at night outside was a bit of a pain but we had the window open and people were on holidays and out having fun. Could be us next time! No complaints about this hotel. It was very nearly perfect and ideal for what we wanted and needed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: Motters1966
Reviews.Content: Located down a side residential street, this hotel is perfect if you want to be in a quieter area, yet steps away from getting to all the popular spots either by foot or using public transportation. The hotel itself is fine, European rooms are small and as long as you accept this before you check in you should not be disappointed. We stayed on the top floor and appreciated the view, however if you are not one to use the stairs, the elevator can delay your movements as there is only one in this old historic building. Having said that I wouldn't let that put you off staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great time and would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: Willibobsauld
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant time. There was 14 of us and the hotel was great for what we wanted. Very friendly at reception and especially in the 'cosy' hotel bar. Think his name was Ziya, so helpful and very funny. The rooms were better than expected and had a great nights sleep. Located in a very quiet area but only 3 minutes from Leidesplein and the park. Heineken Experience is also within walking distance. Only disappointment was the breakfast, very basic. We only ate there one morning. Would recommend eating in the centre or the park. If we decided to go back to Amsterdam would defintely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “WON'T GO BACK TO THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: MenglembuMag
Reviews.Content: The staff ignored the fact that I have a confirmation with the upgraded room rates, charged more on the credit card, I disagreed as I have the confirmation with the upgrade rates.The manager told me the same thing. I mentioned the name of the person who confirm the rates. Finally the manager agreed and refunded the difference of the overcharge. I would not go back to this hotel as I believed they're not honest.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: Green_Day47
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, convenient for the Leidseplein, canal boat cruise, museum district and the number 197 airport bus from Schipol (â‚¬4 each - no need to spend a fortune on taxis!). The room (403) was smaller than we expected, but was clean and comfortable. Despite being in the middle of the summer, the heating in the bathroom was on full blast with no way of switching it off. We resolved this by closing the bathroom door and opening the window. We were on the top floor, so got a good night's sleep. Those in the basement do not fare so well: I overheard 2 different complaints at the desk from people who had had a dismal night under the reception area. Breakfast was tasty, but organisation had collapsed under the weight of people wanting to eat it. We waited five minutes for plates to appear, then a further five minutes for coffee cups. The second morning we went down earlier and watched the latecomers (09:50) suffering the same fate with a lack of crockery and food choices. We would recommend this hotel for location and price, but just be prepared for a couple of imperfections. We will stay there again on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: markmccall
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel primarily because I could use points to stay there and for its location. Perfect for visiting museums, for shopping, and good place for restaurants and shopping. Some complaints - small rooms, no AC so fairly warm (but there was a fan in the room). Even though there is an elevator between floors, one section of the hotel seems to have been built on a different level. On every floor, you had to transverse three steps to the other level. Really a pain when you are moving your luggage to/from the room. Use the front desk to get your tickets to popular museums and other tourist sites - savings and reduced lines at the hotels. When we first visited Amsterdam 40 years ago, complimentary breakfast was standard across the Netherlands. This hotel charges E 10.00 for breakfast (E 7.50 if you reserve the evening before). Breakfast is fairly standard Dutch fare - get there early before the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “liked this place”
Reviews.Author: RoadLessTravelled74
Reviews.Content: we booked directly using the best western website as we had several gift cards we wanted to use and could only do this without a 'middle person'. the non-smoking hotel is about a 15min tram ride from the centre of downtown (we did walk for 45min on the first day from the central train station but then bought the 48hour transit pass to get around town). the hotel is in a 'residential area'. we got the queen size room situated almost directly above the front doors (2floors up), but didnt find it noisy at all. the free wi-fi in the room was a definite plus. breakfast was only â‚¬7.50 (this must be ordered at least the day before). friendly and helpful staff. we had an enjoyable stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, no AC”
Reviews.Author: kanka
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in this hotel, you should be aware that there is no Ac in the rooms. Just fans that makes a lot of noise. The hotel is situated not far away from Leidseplein with a lot of restaurants and also within walking distance to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh-museum. The lady at the desk gave us very nice recommodations for good restuarants. I can recommend Srikandi and Dubbel. The breakfast was quite ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean and not air conditioned undergoing renovation”
Reviews.Author: naomirjerusalem
Reviews.Content: I mistakenly posted my review for a June 2011 stay at this hotel under the name of a different Best Western in Amsterdam apologies please correct

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyt24
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Amsterdam with my boyfriend and both our mothers. Booked a superior twin and double, the twin was superb however, double was very small, this was the olny fault to our fabulous stay. On arrival the staff were very helpful and friendly and we were made to feel welcome. The location could not be better walking distance from Liedse Plane and olny a short tram ride form Central. Booked this hotel in advance and got a reasonable price. Will be back to the hotel hoepfully very soon.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel”
Reviews.Author: pabar48
Reviews.Content: all the staff were pleasant,polite and helpful.rooms were large and spotless clean.breakfast was excellent with good selection of food.small friendly bar(barman zia really good) hotel in walking distance of city centre.would recommend this hotel,and we will go back

Reviews.Title: “very good value and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: SR006
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location at the end of Vondel Park nearest the centre. A few minutes to the museums, about twenty five minutes to Dam Square (half an hour to the station?). For something so near the centre it was wonderfully quiet - we were able to keep the window open all night. (We had a room at the back, though). Not huge amounts of space in the room, but quite enough. The decor is past its best, but fine. The bathroom was old but more than adequate - with a bath. The breakfast very good value. And above all, pleasant, professional staff. We intend to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, clean hotel with wonderfully friendly staff - value for money!”
Reviews.Author: cvn0101
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Leidse Square Hotel is tucked away in a beautiful, serende neighbourhood just behind Leidse Square (a popular and bustling area in Amsterdam) and very close to Vondel park. The hotel is very close to a tram stop on 3 of the main tram lines and easily accessible from both the airport and Central Station. We were travelling with an 18 month old baby and booked a double room which was surprisingly spacious at Amsterdam standards. We also requested a baby cot for our son when we made the reservation online, which was ready and waiting in our room upon arrival. The baby cot and bedding provided was crisp and clean and looked brand new. The rest of the room was equally clean and inviting with more than enough space for our luggage. Breakfast cost EUR7.50 per person (if booked upfront) and was good value for money. Overall we loved staying at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. We would certainly return to the hotel should we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT LEAVE YOUR BELONGINGS LYING ABOUT IN THE HOTEL ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: Claire-Highlands
Reviews.Content: Did not have a great experience when staying in this hotel for 6 days at the start of May. On the third day, an item of my clothing went missing from the hotel room. It was a white, hooded sweat top which I had left in the room whilst I went out for the day. On my return in late evening, I discovered the top was no longer in the room. The room was literally turned upside down, everything was turfed out of the cases and the wardrobe but to no avail, the top was not there. I reported it to Reception the following morning. There was a slight air of uninterest and I was simply told they would check laundry later that day to see if it had been taken there by accident. Surprise surprise, on checking with Reception later on, discovered it hadn't been! For the next few days, whoever I spoke to on Reception, had no idea about my missing top, so it involved me having to go through the whole rigmarole again of explaining why I was at the desk only to be told to check the following day for the return of the laundry. One member of staff told me they had never heard of anything going missing before, another said it had happened on several other occasions. The woman who cleaned our room was apparently a temporary member of staff not in each day, yet I was told by another Receptionist that all their staff worked there for 20 years!! Even on the day before we left, again we were told to wait until the laundry was returned the following day to see if it had turned up. At this point, I stated I wished to make a complaint. There was no senior members of staff on the premises and no one knew the complaints procedure. I was simply told to leave my details with Reception the following day during checkout. On doing this, I again had to explain why I needed to do it and was simply handed a ripped out piece of paper on a notepad to write down my details! Hardly professional. So I duly returned to the UK without my top and emailed a letter of complaint to Best Western Head Office based in Phoenix. They responded within hours telling me they would pass my letter on to the hotel which they duly did. As predicted, their letter was full of apologies and claimed they spoke to housekeeping but the woman who cleaned our room couldn't recall seeing any such top so I guess it did grow arms and legs and walk out of the room by itself after all!! They offered me a discount on a future stay as consolation, well I would rather have my top back, the same top I have had for 3 years, which has travelled with me to various destinations, as far afield as Florida and always come back as has the rest of my belongings. From now on, any future trips I take abroad, I no longer will be so trusting as to leave any items lying out inexpensive or otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job perfectly ..”
Reviews.Author: Deltablade
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in a quiet street but easily accessible to Leidse Square from where trams take you wherever you need to go (that said, we chose to walk for the majority of our stay to absorb the culture and by so doing discovered hidden gems not always captured in the guide books). Hotel was spotless and staff engaging & friendly; room size adequate, had everything you needed and it all worked (shower especially good!) Our room was at the back and we didn't hear a peep but our friends' room was front-facing and they were disturbed by a short period of hustle bustle around 4am every morning (presume new arrivals or revellers, could happen anywhere of course). Bed was v comfortable & towels were changed daily. Wardrobe contained a safe (full marks for this, a sound hotel policy). B'fasts were fine - though the cooked food could have been a tad hotter - with a good selection on offer. Barman Zia (Turkish) was a hoot & over a nightcap told us many a tale of his many exploits all over the world whilst we relaxed from the dayâ€™s exertions! On the last day we were able to store our luggage in a basement store after checking out - a logical but excellent facility. In summary, if you are looking for refinement or have a need to be feted you might wish to go further upmarket but on a value for money rating this hotel ticks all the boxes & more. Interestingly, this is the second BW hotel I have used in the last 12 months ..there is no doubt they are raising their game. Would return without question.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated clean comfortable friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inishowen61
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent The staff were friendly and helpful. Room was tidied each morning before we came back from breakfast. Towels and soaps all replaced. The room itself was very comfortable Plenty of lamps and sockets. Big double wardrobe with hangers and best of all most comfortable mattress I have ever had in hotel. The location was quiet but not far from amenities Very near to Hard Rock Cafe and Leidseplein where there was always a lot happening. The stairs were a bit steep but there is a lift provided which made getting to room no problem Shuttle bus service was available to and from this hotel to airport which made everything cheaper as taxis can be a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: atk1031
Reviews.Content: I booked Best Western Leidse Square largely because it's 100% no-smoking, and it turned out to be a good choice in other ways. It's located conveniently close to the Leidseplein bus and tram stops, and you can easily get to and from both the airport and the main train station. It's also close to a large number of restaurants and stores, and a short walk to the major museums and to the Blue Boat canal cruises. The rooms are small but equipped with comfortable beds, free WiFi, good air conditioning, a coffee/tea maker, and a large safe. The bathroom is a good size, but water pressure in the shower is pretty weak. There is no mini-bar, but the small lobby has drink and snack machines. The breakfast buffet was substantial. Although not included in the room rate, the usual 10-euro charge is reasonable, and if you book the night before, you can get it for 7.50. The only real drawback during my stay was quite a lot of street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ScottNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the end of a two week vacation with family. Rooms were no frills, value was good for Amsterdam. Location was key to this hotel, less than 5 minute walk to Leidsplein, shops, restaurants, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient and Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location of this hotel - it is within a stone's throw of Leidseplein, yet very quiet. My room was unusually large, and the bathroom had a bathtub. It was clean, and the front desk staff were very responsive. My only disappointment is that they did not give me any Best Western points because I had booked the hotel using booking.com, and not the Best Western site.

Reviews.Title: “Eden leidse square hotel really was as if discovering Eden in Amsterdam!!”
Reviews.Author: michaelweir_77
Reviews.Content: It had been said, by our travelling friends (veterans of twelve holidays in Amsterdam) that this hotel was the best value for money they experienced here. Free tea and coffee, internet access, excellent buffet breakfast included, a bar open to 2am, modern onsuite rooms, schiphol connection right outside the front door, 5-10 mins walk from Leidseplein square, very friendly staff, luggage storage, safes in rooms, lifts, and all for 80 euros per double room per night! I can't recommend the Eden Leidsesquare hotel (Theatre District) highly enough based on comparable hotels aviailable in this area. Michael & Katherine (Ireland)

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarita88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the end of february and It was a really nice experience. The hotel is in a residential area just two minutes walking to the greatest party area in the city, Leidseplein. In this area you can find a lot of pubs, discos and of course COFFEESHOPS! There is "The Bulldog Palace" one of the best coffeeshops in Amsterdam. Leidseplein is also a great place for take a coffee in the morning or have lunch/dinner. To go from Centraal Station to the hotel,you can take any tram which goes to Leidseplein, if I don't remember very bad 1,3 and 5 takes you to Leidseplein in no more than 10 minutes!!!! Rooms are very nice, beds are comfortables and the most important thing in winter, heater works very well. The receptionist who attended us was very pleasant and you can find any tourist information in the lobby area. I'm really sure I will return to Amsterdam and I will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, clean rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Cleve2010
Reviews.Content: This was my sixth stay at the hotel. I bring a large group of students and faculty to Amsterdam for a course on social policy. We were pleased once again with our accommodations. I also want to commend all of the staff at the hotel. Each person was gracious and went out of their way to make our trip very pleasant. My large group of students in their 20s were eager explorers of the city. They asked for help in finding restaurants in their price range, in getting tickets to popular sites, and directions to numerous locations. In every instance the staff was very helpful. The breakfast has been upgraded and should meet any expectations. I know that my hungry students were very satisfied. There is a small bar room with a very friendly host. You will enjoy chats with him. The location is near the major art museums and an entertainment district. Also, major tram lines are a short walk from the hotel so it is easy to get anywhere. WIFI is now free at the hotel. This is a very nice addition. I recommend Leidse Square Hotel to my friends who travel to Amsterdam because I know they will have a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was fine and price was reasonable for center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: IainBrighton
Reviews.Content: We (Iain, Joan & son Cormac) stayed here during a recent visit to Amsterdam. The hotel was fine and we stayed in room 301 as a family room. At â‚¬89 for the night, had no complaints and the breakfast at â‚¬10 each (buffet style) was a fair price for a hotel. After reading some of the reviews, we were concerned about booking a room here but 301 as a family room was fine. Hotel staff were polite and friendly. There is also a luggage room if you are not leaving until late but need to book out in the morning. To get to to the hotel from the train station is very easy and just get the 1 or 5 tram which takes you to within 2 minutes of the front door if you get off at Leidse Square

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: KarenTurek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Western Leidse Square Hotel for 3 nights in a triple room and we have no complaints. Reservation was made by internet and there was no problem during the check-in. Hotel is located in a calm street with about 3 minutes walk from Leidseplein (which leads to Leidsestraat), 2 minutes from Vondelpark, 3 minutes from Holland Cassino (Max Euwe plein) and 5 minutes from Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum (Museumplein). Our room was at the 1st floor, was very quiet and provided a good night of sleep. The room was found very clean with a good beds and pillows. The breakfast was very good and is not included in the reservation which is 10 euros per person. Hotel provides a free internet at the hotel's lobby if you need to consultate something or just update your email reviews. Overall facilities was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the right place”
Reviews.Author: MiKaKiev
Reviews.Content: Descent hotel in a very convenient location. Air traffic is making some noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JP-ontour
Reviews.Content: The BW Leidse Square is located close to one of the nightlife hotspots. Hard Rock Cafe and further bars and restaurants are literally across the street, but the hotel is located in a small quiet side street. Also a walk into the main city center is possible or you can take the tram from Leidse Square. The hotel is all good but my room was a little bit small. But this might be typical as it is directly in the city with older houses. The staff was very friendly as helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short break”
Reviews.Author: amcgauley
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, really close to Leidseplein. Lovely comfy beds and nice clean rooms. Felt very secure and the safe was very useful. However Dam Square and the Red Light district are quite a walk away but it was not really an issue. Breakfast was not included and it was expensive to opt to have it. Overall a good hotel for a mini break in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location, but noise a problem.”
Reviews.Author: carpediem89
Reviews.Content: Difficult to find. The room we had was on the ground floor. We could hear people talking and walking in the hallway as well as people in the adjacent rooms. Had a poor night's sleep. Reception person was sympathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, clean & quiet rooms with the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept on”
Reviews.Author: SteveS87
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, which is quiet and residential, whilst only being a few minutes walk from Leidseplein where there are plenty of restaurants, bars and nightlife. It is also close enough to the centre to make all the main attractions easily walkable or a simple tram ride away. The hotel staff are cheerful, helpful and friendly and my wife and I had a very pleasant stay here for 3 nights over a weekend. The hotel was very quiet and we were not disturbed at all, despite it being a weekend close to Christmas. The beds have superb mattresses which are extremely comfortable. The rooms are very clean and whilst relatively compact are comfortable and well furnished, including a desk, flat screen TV, safe etc. I should not forget to mention the free wi-fi available in all rooms either. Also, despite us not leaving until late each morning the room was always fully serviced, even on the Sunday. All in all, a very pleasant, well run hotel that was a pleasure to stay in. I would not hesitate to return and can whole-heartedly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Jasperw
Reviews.Content: Wow; If you need a place downdowndowntown Amsterdam for a bargain pick this one. It's clean, the Wifi is free and the bed is comfy....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: paulh1941
Reviews.Content: We, a group of eight (youngest 15 â€“ eldest 72), spent 6 days at the hotel in November 2010 and were very satisfied. It is excellent location to explore Amsterdam...tram is 2 blocks with lines 1, 2 and 5 which run to flower market, Dam and Central Station....Van Gogh, Heineken and Lageplan with in walking distant... a lot of restruatants at Leidse Square, 2 blocks away....rooms were very clear..beds were super comfortable....staff was very helpful and the breakfast was good. Breakfast was 10 Euro which seemed high but was less than any other places we could find and had unlimited food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better hotels in Amsterdam than this one”
Reviews.Author: robin02907
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a good experience here. With one exception, the employees at the front desk were surly and arrogant, and not at all helpful. We had the misfortune to be in Amsterdam when a convention was in town, and apparently the hotel staff thought that was a good reason tobe nasty, treat their guests poorly, and also charge way too much for a below quality room. Our room was in the basement, near the boiler room and directly under the front desk and lobby. When we first checked in, we noticed a periodic "chirping" noise -- like a cricket -- coming from someplace in the room. It was actually coming from above us, something going on with the front desk area over our heads. That noise wasn't as bad as the thumping and bumping sounds that went on pretty much all night and every night, and we unfortunately stayed there for 3 nights. I wish I could give it lower ratings for service, value and sleep quality, it was really awful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location/Bargain”
Reviews.Author: MarciaKH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year in a tiny room, but didn't stay in it much anyway so opted for it again with European Destinations package because: it is in an excellent location and they have a delicious and varied breakfast buffet included. Since the food is generally pretty boring in Amsterdam at our price range, it's nice to have a substantial breakfast to get you through the better part of the day. This year our room was spacious (for Europe) and lovely. The bed was so comfortable, you wanted to stay in it. We had an electric vessel for hot water so we could have tea, etc., and there is a good hair dryer and personal care items. Clean towels everyday, and housekeeping. Just don't bother asking for ice. :( The location is very close to Leidse Square, museums and nightlife, but on a quiet street behind the Mariott. It felt very safe. The staff was fun, and I shared some crazy adventures with them, and in turn they made me chuckle with their quips, too. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again at the Leidse Square Hotel. The place and the people made our stay very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Small room.”
Reviews.Author: Tripsntravels88
Reviews.Content: If location is your priority and you will be spending little time at the hotel then book here if you can find a cheap deal. Otherwise I would say look elsewhere. Like the previous poster, I also found it rather worrying that you hand in the card key when leaving the hotel and say your room number on your return. Also, we wanted to leave our suitcase at the hotel for a couple of hours on our last day and we had to take it down to a room ourselves which was full of other people's luggage. Staff were friendly enough. Room clean but tiny. We booked through lastminute.com and needed to pay city tax on arrival - around 5 euros for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location, and value for money, but questionable security”
Reviews.Author: itsafrogslife
Reviews.Content: We booked a couple of days in Amsterdam at short notice, and went for Best Western Leidse Square Hotel because it had rooms available at a reasonable price. The room was good, and clean, and was quiet too (something you don't always get from hotels closer to the centre). Our only concern is that you have to hand your room key back every time you leave, and when you return you simply give your room number. As far as I can see there's nothing stopping anyone from walking in and asking for the key to a room that isn't theirs, given that no checks were made.

Reviews.Title: “Really good choice”
Reviews.Author: AllanFigueiredo
Reviews.Content: Excelent location, excelent room, excelent services. When i'm back to Amsterdam it will be absolutely my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average Quality Hotel close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: heathoz
Reviews.Content: Our advise to you is make sure you book a room with airconditioning, we arrived when it was very very hot, there were people at reception trying to change room to an airconditioned one. Luckily when we booked we stipulated we wanted to pay for airconditioning in our room. Room was huge, excellent. Close to everything easy to find our way around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,basic hotel with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Dkerr_10
Reviews.Content: On arriving at this hotel we were promptly and politely dealt with (we arrived late afternoon). The room was adequate; clean, with tv, hairdryer,tea/coffee making facilities and we were able to open the window for air. There was some noise from the street below during the night but when the window was closed it was barely audible. Conveniently located as its a short walk to nearby Vondel Park, shops, restaurants, bars and museums. Transfer to the airport via bus is simple. The stop is a short walk away and the trip only costs about 4 euro. (we found this much easier to negotiate than the trains to central station) There were two things about the hotel which we think are worth mentioning - We found the breakfast was very average for the price! However there were a lot of cafes and restaurants nearby and it wasn't a problem. Also our room was located on the third floor. As I dont like the lift I had to climb the stairs and believe me they are steep! Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it One word of warning! Watch out for bicycles, there are a lot of them in Amsterdam!!.

Reviews.Title: “Considering the price this is certainly...”
Reviews.Author: thegunners1978
Reviews.Content: Considering the price this is certainly worth the money. Was looking for something in the City centre but was finding the prices sky high but this place is a very happy compromise. The biggest plus is the location, a really good spot to explore the city but not so central that it's noisy or congested. The rooms need a bit if re-decorating but all things considered this hotel is good. Would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with nice location”
Reviews.Author: Kanerva
Reviews.Content: Stayed two night at Best Western Leidse Square. Booked this hotel because our first choices were fully booked. We weren't really impressed by the lobby area, but as we got into our room in the afternoon, we were happy to see that the upper floors were tidier than then ones we saw when taking our bags to the luggage room. The room was clean and not the smallest, had clean bathroom and was basic but did the job. There's a safe and a hair dryer in the room, plus free WiFi. A down side is poor sound proofing. You can hear everything from the next room and the corridor. The hotel is nicely located near Leidse Square. Not so near it would be too noisy, but just next to canal boat station, bus lines, tram line and still on a walking distance from Jordan and even Red Light district etc. Rijksmuseum, van Gogh museum and Heineken are within 5 minutes walking distance. There's a very convenient bus connection to the airport (only 4 eur).

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisweger
Reviews.Content: Centrally located Hotel Close to the City Center in Amsterdam, the paradiso concert Hall, the Vondel Park and Major Shopping streets. Friendly Staff, stylish inferior. Well placed for Shopping stroll down the exklusive Street with Lots of Shops and Bars where the Hotel is located, Howards Vondel Park for some Major Shopping. Also very Close to Major Museums. Would definately stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go there again.”
Reviews.Author: aabdulmageed
Reviews.Content: Arrived to Amsterdam after a tour in Paris, Disney, and Rome. This was the least impressive through the whole trip. The hotel location and free internet were the good things in this hotel. Breakfast was also not bad. On the negative side, I was given a room in the basement. When asked to change, I was told the hotel was fully booked and I should be glad to have an A/C in the room! The receptionist said there were 10 basement rooms, I saw 2 only. The safe box was not working...shower sink almost blocked... TV remote hidden in a file (seems like a legal advice to make sure the guest reads the hotel instructions before using the TV, who cares about customer satisfaction). Lastly, the hotel offerred viewing porn movies for charge. Im not sure if this is a standard practice in Amsterdam hotels, but I think this is too low.

Reviews.Title: “Good Peace of mind hotel”
Reviews.Author: vforsey
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance from Vondel Park, Van Gogh Museum, etc. Anne Frank house about 20min walk away. Hotel room smaller but is very clean and everything you need is in it. Buffet included and it includes boiled and scrambled eggs, bacon, croissants, lunch meat, cheeses and cereals. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful. Price is decent for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “This one deserves its stars”
Reviews.Author: MNemo07
Reviews.Content: Comming directly from the Europa 92 hotel (see my review), I found here: . True quiet rooms with air conditioning. . Nice and clean rooms and hotel . Free wireless internet acces (should be everywhere in 2010) . A true, good breakfast. You can even ask for a hot chocolate, made just for you. . A friendly bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: maniglia
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights. Very good hotel and good breakfast. The internet is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AND ROOM”
Reviews.Author: Louistraveler1024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days/3 nights. the room was neat and roomy, and the beds were comfy. we had a small terrace overlooking the street which was really nice. the breakfast was adequate, the coffee good. the staff wre very helpful, easily speaking english all the time , which made life a bit easier also the entire staff was very helpful and eager to help with reservations and directions. the area was great, right behind the Marroit, and a 3 min. walk to leidse Square and many cafes and shops. our teens jhad their own room, which worked out great. we really enjoyed our stay here, with no coplaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some minor problems”
Reviews.Author: irfanbiyik
Reviews.Content: Problems: We have stayed in this hotel as two families of 4 people in each. We were given the rooms at the -1 floor (rooms #004 and #006) since they claimed that these are the only rooms they have for four people. The room #006 is OK but We do not suggest the room #004 since it has a small heater which is insufficient to heat up the room. The room has a window from which cold wind flows in. The shape of the room is like a corridor making it totally unusable. We discussed these problems with the hotel staff and they agreed to give us an additional room for free. This solution reduced our discomfort with the room but this time the family was divided into two. Two of us stayed in the #004 room and other two stayed in the second room. So, avoid the room #004. Some of the reservation staff are rude. Location: The hotel is at a good location, just behind the Marriot Hotel. It is close to major sites and TRAMS 1 2 and 5 pass by. (We highly recommend the GVB 1-5 days tickets.) The busses 197 and 370 can be used from/to the airport. Their bus stop is very close to the hotel. Services: There is free internet at the lobby, key is provided for the laptops (I do not know if charged). The breakfast is server between 07:30 and 10:00. The content is rich enough (cereals, fruit, ham cheese, a selection of bread and boiled eggs together with juices and tea and coffee) and replaced very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “don t go to that hotel what you see on internet is not what you get”
Reviews.Author: minhoca
Reviews.Content: I paid Â£248(which you first thing when you check-in before seeing your room) for 2 nights and was offered room number 10, which is a 1* hotel room. I complained and was offered a slightly better room but dirty, dust everywhere, hair in the bath and very dark room, I complained and was told that the next day my room would be cleaned properly. Next day the room was exactly the same, the bed has badly been made I had to wear shoes to have a shower because the bath was dirty. It was a rip-off. I sent a later to the hotel complaining which they answered after many days and because I had to sent it twice, in the letter they apologise and are sorry that they cant change the situation. Yf you have a reservation recommend you cancel it. It s a rip-off

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2_kids_under_2
Reviews.Content: No real complaints about this hotel, but would say accommodation waqs average rather than brilliant. Location is great and I suspect this is what you are paying the money for. Staff at reception were frinedly and helpful, rooms were basic but clean. We stayed with two small children in a triple room with cot. We were initially given a ground floor room (no 11) to amke access easy but room was very close to the hotel bar and smokers stood outside bedroom windows chatting into early hours - avoid if you want a quiet night. Staff were happy to move us to a quieter room next day. Breakfast was plentiful, with good choice and there was a high chair available for little ones. All in all not a bad hotel, but did feel it was a little over-priced. Tips: - If you're travelling with small people, the Vondel Park is very close to the hotel (2min walk) and is a brilliant place for kids, with small play parks and duck ponds, our son had a ball each morning before going for a sleep in his pram and allowing grown ups to do there thing! - Also recommend taking bus 197 from Schippol (stop B11) direct to Leidse Plein, takes about 1/2hour, costs 4 euros per person and was pretty quiet both times we used it. - Hotel has no room service which is not ideal when travelling with kids, but plentiful supply of cheap friendly eateries near by, open all day so early dining no problem

Reviews.Title: “Location Great - Hotel mediocre”
