Reviews.Author: LondonMadmax
Reviews.Content: Well located close to museum and Leidse Plein, however suited more to young backpackers. The room is comfortable but quality of finishes is poor. Breakfast buffet is more canteen style and public areas more like a youth hostel or student halls of residnce, That said, on a budget it is OK, but the price reflects the quailty

Reviews.Title: “Great value, rooms and location - best for under 100 EUR”
Reviews.Author: alikus
Reviews.Content: Simply great for a 3 stars in the Netherlands: clean, bigger room (stayed at ground floor), cosy, quiet, perfectly connected to all the attractions by foot. Great value indeed! Including a nice breakfast, nothing unusual about it, just good.

Reviews.Title: “Small Quet Room But Needs Helpful Front Staff”
Reviews.Author: DCSacramento
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in the popular Leidse Square area that is back off of the busy streets. We stayed in four nites in May. On the pluses it is in a quiet location and convenient to many sites including the museums. There is free internet access with no restrictions in the lounge. The breakfasts are fairly good in quantity with a wide selection of items to choose from. The rooms however are dreadly small. Our room on the first floor had been divided in two and was approximately 120 square feet. The windows are single paned and any noise out in front you will hear nearly every word. The bathroom however was great and everything in the room was cleaned daily by the staff. On the negative site the front desk staff are not helpful. Simple questions as if you could mail a postcard for me were not answered. If you make your reservation late you are told that breakfast is not included in the rate. While at the computer I noted some inconsistencies in what various single persons who showed up unannounced were charged. So please check the rates in advance. After paying for the room on the third day of our staff the front desk person indicated they had mistake on the rate and demanded that we pay an additional 40 euros because of an internal mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluebell09
Reviews.Content: Good location (once we found it) in quiet area although still central. The room we were allocated was fairly small and on the dark side â€“ we had requested a bright room, but not complaining as it served its purpose, was nice and warm / well equipt. Breakfast was continental buffet style â€“ plenty of everything and of a good standard seating area spacious and bright, lots of seating. The hotel had a small bar which was rather expensive but ok for a one off drink. Overall had a nice stay here at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is right...great location!”
Reviews.Author: eshia01
Reviews.Content: Location: Avoid the craziness of Central Station. Take the bus 197 outside the airport ( at B11 as I recall). It stops at right at leiseplein. As you get off, face south and head toward the Marriot. Its right behind the Marriot so you could walk along either side of the Marriot and it will lead you there. The location was excellent: far enough from the craziness, but 5-10 minute to the trams, museums, and square. All of amsterdam is accessible by tram, bike, or walking (which I highly suggest). The staff was very nice and helpful to us. The only unusual part was our room didn't have a safe, which the staff's response was "that's unusual", but they allowed us to store our personals in a sealed envelope in their safe (not accessible 11pm-7am). It worked out fine. The rooms were very small but comfortable. My wife and I loved the mattresses, best sleep in europe so far). The breakfast was standard. The only knock is that they charge 10 euros for internet. TIP: Don't forget to stock up on water and snacks for the room as, although convienently located, can be a pain to walk to the closest store/vendor at night.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location & very affordable, could use better front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: ssh217
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at Leidse Square at 8am after our flight from US. I had accidently booked a room twice through 2 different websites. I never received the first confirmation (booking.com), called Best Western to see if I had a reservation and was told no, so I booked another room through Best Western's website. This made the woman working the front desk more upset than my husband and I. We apologized and said it was fine if we had to pay for both rooms to which she replied its not fine. As impersonable was she was, she did only charge us for one room and we were able to get into a room immediately, which we were very thankful for. The woman who took over later in the day was not any nicer and was quite rude to an Italian couple who checked in while we were in the lobby. The room was as expected for a Best Western. It was clean and the bed was very comfortable (especially if you like softer beds). The room wasn't incredibly big but there was room for a couch. The shower wasn't roomy but the pressure was good. Breakfast was included in the rate but we chose to go to the Pancake House. If you have to leave your luggage in storage, beware that it will be kept in the bar area. We were told it would be locked up but when we returned the lock was just a velvet rope across the door. The location was great. You are right by Leidseplein--a major nighlife & dining area. You are also very close to all the museums. Amsterdam is a walking city so we walked everywhere--took about 15 minutes to get to Anne Frank's house and 20 minutes to Centraal Station but that was the farthest we ever had to walk. Dining and other attractions were always within a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location in lively Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: carynne55
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, just off Leidseplein but in quiet road. Don't expect luxury but what you get is a very clean room with comfortable new-looking beds for a good (warm) nights sleep in freezing Amsterdam! Bathroom was smallish but had all facilities with a selection of toiletries and plenty of towels changed every day. The tea tray was much appreciated although the milk could be improved upon. Reception staff were always polite to us, the barman was chatty and friendly. We did not encounter any noisy fellow guests as others have. When booking to visit Amsterdam, many hotels seemed to charge extra for breakfast. It was included here and was more than adequate with cereals, fruit, ham cheese, a selection of bread and boiled eggs together with juices and tea and coffee. We were quite satisfied with this. If you want good clean comfortable facilities in a quiet yet convenient and central area with a decent breakfast then I would recommend this Best Western hotel to you. We were always happy to return there after a day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you expect from a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Angelica_Demon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights (Saturday and Sunday) as part of a city break in Amsterdam. The location and exterior of the hotel I can't fault at all. If you don't plan on spending 'quality' time in your hotel, this is the place for you. Our room was larger than I am used to in European city hotels, with a predictably small but clean and functional bathroom with a frankly lovely shower over a good sized bath.The sheets weren't changed during our stay but the bed was turned down and towels changed so this is fine. Breakfast was good enough with nice quality food but the Sunday morning was crazy! I recommend getting in there early to avoid the rabble of students and families all cramming around the toast machine, we went down at 10am when the breakfast ends at 10.30 so that was our mistake!! The hotel interior itself is tired and old which is a shame and the reception desk had a multitude of different staff, some very helpful with letting us borrow an umbrella to some with barely any English who seemed reluctant to give us our key. Which brings me to another flaw - you drop your key off on your way out and buzz to get back in and ask for your key. Very odd I thought, not sure if they have a lot of people running off without paying or something!! Another thing to be aware of it is on the face of it, we thought the hotel was quiet but quickly realised that the soundproofing between floors is not great (leading us to think a family of elephants had rented the room above us!) and the sheer multitude of students and groups means a bit too much running around and laughing in the corridors at 4 in the morning for my liking. Not sure who on earth uses the frankly pointless bar next to reception when you are on the doorstep of so many great brown bars, clubs and pubs - the only people seemed to be a group of the hotel staffs friends who were all middle-aged men. All in all, a great base to discover Amsterdam if don't expect the Ritz. It isn't dirty, it is functional and in some ways comfortable - which is really what you should expect from your average Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, good price, quite good locations, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KamilaS3
Reviews.Content: This hotel has quite good location. Near are tram and bus stops, a few minutes walk to the main parts of Amsterdam. There's very helpful staff, waiting for You with smile. The room was clean, also the bath. One I don't like in the bath was shower curtain instead of real shower cabin. Every room has its own little electric kettle, 2 cups, tea and instant coffee. I think it's very nice and I like it. Hotel's restarurant is for breakfasts only (I think so). Breakfast was quite tasty and varied (cheese, boiled eggs, sausage, jams, juices, tea and coffee). I think it's good hotel for people who want to have quite good location, good transportation and good price to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, probably wouldn't stay here for a personal vacation”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninRome13
Reviews.Content: Now a part of the Best Western Chain, the location is nice and quiet, and a very beautiful area, close to the tram and some shopping and eating areas, probably a 30-minute walk to Centraal Station. I stayed here on a business trip that was booked for me. I had a few issues making my reservations before hand and then a few issues once I got here, but it was all straightened out. I guess my problem with this hotel was it just didn't impress me. The hotel seemed tired-looking to me, not necessarily dirty, but just run-down. The staff wasn't rude, but not very memorable either. I had to pay â‚¬10 per day to use the wireless in my room. The room was clean, but the furniture was old and tired-looking. Also, the room was very dark at night, the only lights I had were the night-stand lights. The bed was comfortable, I think they have new mattresses. The bathroom was ok, a tight fit, and the tub was very slippery and difficult to get in and out of. The curtain was kind of gross, but not mildewy or moldy. The hallways in the hotel were noisy with guests all night long, but I guess that's Amsterdam. Breakfast was included and was actually decent, a large selection.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and close to lots of venues”
Reviews.Author: Basalt2003
Reviews.Content: Arrived here with friends for a very brief stay ( two nights) and found it to be a very clean and tidy place. Nice situation not far from the bustle of Leidsplein but in a quiet street. I had no problems with reception when we arrived and was treated very politely - - with a smile too. Breakfast was good with a well maintained/stocked buffet. I did not use the bar so cannot comment - - we were out late elsewhere. We all enjoyed our stay but I would point out to those that need it - - its a no smoking hotel with a 200 euro fine if caught! It was very good value and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to leidseplein & good hotel for a medium budget”
Reviews.Author: GoldLina
Reviews.Content: Great location close to leidseplein (leidse square). Location is the best thing about this hotel. The hotel it-self is OK. It's rated as a 3-star hotel & I think that's correct. The staff isn't super friendly but as long as you don't bother about that you'll be fine. The breakfast is OK, it's buffet style, the are 3 different kind of breads, 2 kind of yogurts & 3-4 kinds of cereals, ham & cheese & fruit, coffee & tea & juice. There are a few sweets but not that much. With Scandinavian measures (large & healthy) this breakfast is OK (not more, not less). On the minus side the WiFi was expensive. Good hotel for a medium budget - remember you usually geat what you pay for & that applies to this place as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but rude front desk”
Reviews.Author: Mickeygogo
Reviews.Content: Located is fairly close to main transportation. Bargain price for small room. Safe and one of the lights in our room was not working. We found one of the front desk staff, I think the name is Mia or Mya very unfriendly and not willing to help with tourist information. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice service”
Reviews.Author: isasshax
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Leidse Square Hotel 3 times and mostly every time I visit Amsterdam I choose it. It's not super cheap, but not too expensive and I think it is quite comfy. Any of the times I stayed I chose one of the air conditioned rooms, cause it was winter and didn't need it. But rooms were warm and very well heated. Also included a coffee/tea maker that was handy when fighting the cold brought from outside! Some rooms are smaller than others, but none of the 3 I've got were tiny. All of them had a TV, free safe and an electric fan. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom and toileteries. Plenty of towels too. Everything was clean and cosy. Main thing I missed was a free internet connection at the lobby. It was quite pricey. Breakfast was included and was very a good buffet style one: boiled eggs, ham, cheese, cereal, youghurt, different bread rolls, toasts, coffee, tea... for me it was more than enough! There's also a vending machine with chips, snacks and soft drinks. The bar was small but nice and the barman was entertaining and provided good service. One of the things why I like this hotel is the location. It is very near the Leidseplein, an area with lots of shops, restaurants and cafes. It's not in the middle of the noise tho, but in a nice quiet street at the other side of the canal. The Vondelpark and the Museum Plein are just a short walk away. Many canal cuises have stops nearby. About the public transport, at Leidseplein you can find various buses and tram stops that can take you almost everywhere. There's also a direct bus connection with the airport that takes you to Leidseplein in a bit less than 30 minutes. If I am not wrong, 197 and 370 are the ones. If you stay in this hotel or this area, better the bus service than the train to the central station. If you need to catch a very early flight, there's also a shuttle mini-bus service for various hotels around, including this one, but that's a lot more expensive than the regular ones I mentioned before. The concierges at the hotel were very nice in each stay. In the last one they also saved my luggage at a storage room. When I go back to Amsterdam I will probably be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renatamsg
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel! The location is excellent, really close to Leidseplain and many Tram lines, restaurants, Vondelpark and commercial center. Walking distance from Museumplein. The room is bigger than average in Europe, so is the bathroom. Room and bathroom were clean enough, no complaints. I would say the only bad thing is that the room is so big that the heater was not able to warm it enough during the night and that were no extra blankets in the closet. But this is a really small detail in a great stay. One other negative point: internet access (wi-fi) available but too expansive!!! The staff was very helpful when we needed some information about the city and tours. Breakfast is great: 3 or 4 kinds of bread, cheese, eggs, tea, juices, milk. Even more than expected. Would certanly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: top chef woodie
Reviews.Content: Got back on Friday 11th Dec. Great stay at the hotel,Great stay in Amsterdam. No complaints. Warm welcome,warm spacious room (401) .89 Stairs for me ( I dont do LIFTS.but worth the walk) Breakfast ,everything you need,good Coffee,Orange Juice,Cerial ,Toast,Boiled Egg,Ham Cheese,need I go on. Location Excellent. Leidse Square 5mins there (20 minutes Back) Same distance just slower walking. Museums and the Vold(whatever) Park 5mins. Get a I LOVE AMSTERDAM CARD,excellent valus,you will save a fortune! Trust me! Im frugal with my spends,well my wife is, she dont give me much. Whatever you do MIND THE BIKES,there everywhere,dont be fooled by the Crossings they will mow you down anywhere.I didnt realise,Its compulsery in Amsterdam,to Use Your Mobile Phone Whilst CYCLING..Failure to do so will result in an instant FINE. Take Care Have a Great Time,at The Leidse Square. Paul WOODIE Woodruff

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: smedly16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, 5 minute walk to the busy Leisdseplien area. It is also just a 10 min walk to the Heineken Brewery. I felt very safe in the area of the hotel as apposed the the Centrum Area that can be a little seedy at night. Room and Hotel are very clean. Staff were welcoming and friendly. My double room was small for American standards but not for European standards. If you are traveling solo, opt for the Double room for a few euros more. Breakfast was ok, breads, breakfast meats, cereal, cheese, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: MumandEleanor
Reviews.Content: Whole stay very good. Stayed at hotel on recommendation and we were extremely pleased with it; reception helpful, room very clean and quiet, bed extremely comfortable, bathroom clean amd spacious. Better than anything was the excellent location near Van Gogh museum, Vondel Park, Casino, restaurants in Leidseplein etc. Only one complaint in 4 night stay...there were hardly ever any croissants however, breakfast was plentiful although did not vary much. Found excellent Dutch restaurants, Pantry in Leidsekruisstraat, Stoop & Stoop(?) and Westers near the hotel. However if I had known Amsterdam was covered in scaffolding and building works, incl the metro and waterfront, I would leave going until 2014. Highlight for me was the Van Gogh Museum with current Letters exhibition (will cost you Â£18 to see it in London next year). Travel the canals at night and see inside the houseboats...they are fabulous! The bus to the airport is only yards from the hotel...another bonus of the location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location -perfect for a couple of nights!”
Reviews.Author: anfield230287
Reviews.Content: Nice compfortable little hotel on the other side of town. Me and my girlfriend have just returned from amsterdam. After staying at the leidse square I can say it is a good hotel close to all the attractions and in walking distace. th quickest way to the hotel from the top of town is by tram, take the no.5 and get offf at leisdplan. Walk over the road and you wil see a street with a shop called clubmed on the side, walk down the street and you will see the hotel. Hotel- The receptonists were friendly and the rooms were clean, tidy and spacious. The breakfast is ok not the best but a selection of breads, cheeses, yoghurt- a typical european hotel. I got a good deal from apharoms.com. Amsterdam is amazing plenty of shopping, bars an the best of all coffee shops, I would reccommend space cake you can find it in most shops- you will not be dissappointed trust me. All in all a great trip and whatever hotel you pick im sure you will have a good time. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the middle of the town”
Reviews.Author: SandraK4
Reviews.Content: Leidse Square hotel is in the centre of Amsterdam near Hard Rock Cafe. It's a nice small and comfortable hotel for small money. I would go there another time, everyone is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere - This is a less-than-3* hotel that could do better!”
Reviews.Author: Huringen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights last week. Our first impression was the staff: the receptionist was cold and unfriendly with nary a smile of welcome. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 11am, so we had to carry our luggage to the basement storeroom. The location of the hotel is OK though, in a quiet neigbourhood and not too far from the hub of the city. Breakfast was skimpy, with only one hot dish ie. the egg which is hardcooked (no need for use of the disposable egg cups). The chambermaid only partially cleaned our room, barely straightening up the beds and did not even empty our almost full bins on the 2nd day. Towels which were hung up however, were changed. So much for being environmentally friendly. Checking-out at 11am was not usual for us and it was strictly non-negotiable even though we explained that we had a 7pm flight out of Amsterdam. Surprisingly, we were asked to pay EUR9,50 being taxes, although our stay was prepaid as part of a SAS package. After paying cash, the female receptionist simply nodded and said that was all, without even supplying us with an official receipt. Overall I would not stay at this hotel again and as my husband pointed out, it should be rated two stars or less!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, noisy street”
Reviews.Author: itchy55
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews before I left on vacation about this hotel and most were favorable. I totally agree that it's a great place to stay but make sure you stay on the upper floors. I stayed on the first floor and it was quite noisy from all the street noise. Especially if you're a light sleeper like me.

Reviews.Title: “A shaking narrow triple room in the basement”
Reviews.Author: RubriaPetra
Reviews.Content: Very bad experience, funny how the priciest of all the hotels I stayed in Netherlands turn out to be the worst, and anyone booking a triple room, like me, is a candidate for the experience. The room, in the basement of the building, was a narrow corridor, almost no space to walk between the beds and the walls, a small window facing a trashy backyard, reminded me a boat cabin. But the beds were comfy and all I needed was a good night of sleep, which soon I get it will be impossible because the walls and the ceiling constantly trembled with walking and shaking noises, this at 11 pm. The receptionist, laughing, answer me that were normal noise of guests entering the hotel and walking around the bar, and eventually stop when everyone get to their rooms, a couple hours later. ItÂ´s outrageous how a hotel room is placed below staircases and thin walls, a small room full of shakings and noises. Maybe my case is just a matter of unluckiness, but this scam reveals that this hotel is moved by lack of respect to the guests, and you never know if itÂ´s your turn.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, especially for the money.”
Reviews.Author: loulou528
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet neighborhood away from the noise, the hotel is less than 5 minute walk from Leidseplein, tram stop, buses, canal cruises. The room and bathroom were very clean. The bed was very comfortable. We arrived after a flight from the US and expected to wait several hours for our room, but they were able to accommodate us early. The free breakfast helped us save time and money. The carpet in the lobby and hallways could use updating, but other than that, it was a good value for the money. I would stay there again. Tip: The morning excursion to the windmills and fishing villages was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Nicola88
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful and even searched the internet for us for local windmills to visit for a day trip (Zanse Schanns - very nice place to visit) and were overall very welcoming and helpful. I found this hotel to be very clean, the breakfast was plentiful and you get a good choice where you can go up for more if you want and was in a really nice location, right by all the night life (but in a quiet road) and right by Vondelpark where there are some lovely houses and a great park. The beds were very comfy and TV was great (SKY) and the bathroom was spacious with hairdryer, shampoo, towels, soap and shower caps. Overall i was very impressed and would definitely come back here again! They also have a lift if needed and the tram stops are just 2 minute walk with also a tourist information place and a tone of resturants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable queen sized bed, relaxed atmostphere!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly0679
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights, and had absolutely no complaints. We were situated on the 1st floor - room 163 - and faced the Owl Hotel (we were lucky to have 2 windows in our room). The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom recently updated. It was extremely hot while we were there, but despite this the room had 2 fans that we made use of. Apparently half (about 40) of their rooms have a/c but we didn't get one, and we weren't too bothered by it. They let us into our room early, since our flight arrived in the early morning, and didn't charge us extra to hold our bags for a couple of hours while they room was cleaned, or add the 5% charge for paying by credit card that some hotels do. Breakfast was standard dutch fare, however the hard boiled eggs were a definite plus for those trying to fill up for a full day of activity. The location could not be beat - it was so close to Leidseplein, which seemed to be the hub of nighttime activity, but far enough away that you didn't hear any noise. I would absolutely stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone traveling to this amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: peppie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights this weekend. what can I say? I cant fault the hotel, or it's location. Very close to the centre but in a small street away from all the noise and just around the corner from the art museums. The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. the rooms are quiet and you cant hear a pin drop or even people next door or going up and down the corridoor. Breakfast is continental style and included in the price. the rooms are decorated tastefully and are cleaned and made up every day. when I go back to Amsterdam I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You can have another choice”
Reviews.Author: HKKay
Reviews.Content: Except the service, I think overall the hotel is not as good as I expected. First of all, the room is a little bit dark. The light is dim. Secondly, the shower area is so SMALL, even for an asian girl like me ( I got only 95pds and you can imagine how slim I am), I think it is not comfortable to take ahower there. The location is okay, but if i went to Holland again, I would prefer staying near the station or Dam area!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: ski_telemark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing fancy but its very clean and the location is awesome. Staff is nice and helpful and the hotel is very easy to find. Great homebase for your trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Herb
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. The room was spacious, comfy and clean and has been the only hotel room we've stayed in for a long time where we haven't at least heard the neighbours loo flushing! but can honestly say didn't hear a thing so slept well. The breakfast was fine with plenty of it as I know before we booked here alot of Amsterdam hotels don't even provide your own bathroom facilities let alone breakfast and this hotel did both so a definate bonus. The location was really good and after the first day of finding our bearings we walked into the centre no problem and of course you also have the museums nearby. So we would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: martEssex
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in an excellent location just the right distance from Leidse square and Vondel Park

Reviews.Title: “Staff unhelpful at best, rude at times. Rooms OK.”
Reviews.Author: ChucknMichele
Reviews.Content: While checking in we asked for the location of a grocery store. The response was "Why would you want that?" Our stay went downhill from there. The room was OK. Similar to a Motel 6 in the states. Small bathrooms and very tight showers. The security restrictions, such as leave the key at the front desk and multiple signs about protecting your valuables, led me to believe this hotel has had a lot of problems. I know "you get what you pay for" but I paid the extra and moved to the Marriott around the corner for our last night in Amsterdam. I will admit they had the best included breakfast of the six we stayed in on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: buttercup118
Reviews.Content: My mother and I wanted to explore Amsterdam as our last trip together before I "grew up." We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel's helpful management, the cleanliness of the room, the quiet at night, the perfect location for exploring and the wonderful breakfast. Honestly, no complaints! When traveling there from the airport, do NOT take the hotel shuttle. Take the train to central station and the tram. Save yourself net 5 Euros. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The best starting block from which to explore Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugEmma
Reviews.Content: I am recently back from a three night stay at the Leidse Square Hotel, Amsterdam and I have hardly a bad word to say about it - I can't blame my sunburn on the hotel ;)!! I am a young woman (20) and I was travelling with my best female friend - needless to say, my mum worries about 2 vulnerable girls wandering about a different city in a different country...but she had nothing to worry about! The hotel is as safe as could be - there are safes in the rooms and you have to buzz to get in after dark, which made me feel very secure. With respect to the actual hotel, it was lurvely! I haven't stayed in many hotels (3 in total!) but it was the best - spacious, modern, clean, comfortable, suitable bathing facilities and constant hott water - everything you would need right at your fingertips!! I was a lil apprehensive about the size of the room (I didn't want my friend to feel ill at ease if we were forced into stuck-together beds in a miniature room) but there was nothing to worry about at all. I had a short city break to Paris last year and had expected the same kind of thing but the Leidse Square rooms are huge, plenty of room to throw your luggage about. Breakfast was included in our (recession-busting) price and is served at a very reasonable time. Unfortunately, meaty breakfasts i.e ham and rolls and cheese don't get me very excited! But that is more to do with my palate, which is accustomed to a big bowl of cornflakes in the morning than filled bread so it's totally a personal opinion! In terms of location - which is of utmost importance - Leidse Square is on a quiet leafy street, right beside the buzz of the Leidseplein (the home of great...and plentiful food!)! If you were looking for noise and hustle and bustle, you would probably be better situated near Dam Square but we wanted to explore the parks and museums and Red Light District and 'coffee shops' and everything was walking distance - culture and typical tourist attractions! The service was all good - although I would advise internet-users to go elsewhere because the one computer in the hotel is pre-historic! A fab holiday and a fab stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: catemin
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, the room, the breakfast, the location, the staff. It was the perfect place for my daughter and I to stay 3 nights in Amsterdam. Very easy to get to from Central Station. Close to all the action in Leidesplein Square, but on a quite street. Easy walk to trams and buses. The room was very clean and modern. Spacious compared to our room in Paris! The breakfast was really nice to start each day. Recommend Mike's countryside bike tour!! Close to Vondel park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on our first visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MaureenLancs
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short stay at the Leidse Square Hotel . Set on a quiet leafy road close to the Vondel Parc but only minutes away from the Leidseplein . On arrival we were made welcome by the friendly and helpful reception staff who are on hand 24 hours a day to answer queries . Our room was spacious with a balcony overlooking the street . The bedroom and bathroom were spotless and sheets and towels changed daily .The beds are super comfy .We had tea and coffee making facilities which came in handy as Amsterdam is quite pricey .There are safes in the room ,free of charge!! .Breakfast was simple but plentiful . There is a vending machine selling snacks cheaper than in town . No problems at all apart from the crazy cyclists and trams .You need eyes in the back of your head !! There is a restaurant just around the corner of the hotel called Vertigo .It's away from the usual tourist traps . The menu will suit everyone and so will the prices . It has a lovely patio for alfresco dining .I would recommend the hotel and will definitely return .Maureen and Garrry , Burnley Lancs ,U.K.

Reviews.Title: “I know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: AlvinNarod
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several times at this hotel, starting away back when it was called Hotel Terdam. Generally, I've always been very satisfied with the level of comfort and service at this well-located establishment, just off the Leidesplein so away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist area but very accessible either on foot or by tram. It's close proximity to the Museum District also makes it a good location for those who want to visit the few excellent museums close by. Voldelpark is also very near and is a great place to take an after dinner stroll in a summer evening. I've always found the staff very responsive and easy to communicate with. Breakfast is basic standard fare for this type of hotel - nothing to write home about but, if included in your room rate, it's easy to fill up there and skip lunch. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: brianp_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in April. Rooms were clean, staff were polite and very helpful - including helping us with On line Airport check-in. Breakfast was standard but plentiful - we are earlyish risers. Hotel position is very good with rooms quiet and street leafy with little thru traffic and 10 min tram ride from Main Station.

Reviews.Title: “THE perfect hotel for 1st timers Amsterdam visitors!”
Reviews.Author: sarah_miss
Reviews.Content: Lovely, lovely, lovely hotel! We (my partner and I) were so pleased with everything about it, the room was an ideal size for the two of us located on the second floor. EXTREMELY helpful reception staff who spoke a range of different languages fluently and an ideal continental breakfast that set us up for the day ahead and a hotel bar with friendly staff and reasonable prices. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the Van gogh museum (although the museum itself was outrageously boring and massively disappointing), the Rijksmuseum and the Heineken brewery (which is a fabulous experience including complimentary drinks!!) The hotel room has a free map which includes a variety of vouchers for the major attractions and a detailed guide to the surroundings including a list of the tram lines that run directly to the Centraal station. The hotel is ideally located just a 5 minute walk from the Hard Rock Cafe, all the major tram lines and the Canal bus stops, (something we both highly recommend, 20 euros per person valid 24 hours on all three canal routes and you're able to hop on and off as you please, a great way to see the city!, much better than a boring bus you get in most major capital cities!). The room was always cleaned by the time we arrived back to the hotel after a full day out including fresh towels, toiletries and empty bins. You are to hand your room key into reception whenever you leave the hotel and reception is manned behind a locked front door 24 hours a day which made us both feel very safe inside the hotel. Upon arrival we could leave our bags in the locked luggage room and again before we departed for the airport, which again was so easy to get to and recommended by the reception staff to take the bus for 3 euro each rather than the expensive, unreliable shuttle. To sum it up, we will DEFINATELY be recommending this to any of our friends planning on visiting Amsterdam and to any first timers planning a visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: Cymrocymraeg
Reviews.Content: The Leidse Square is a well appointed hotel. Very clean and modern. The room had everything that we needed. You dont go on a city break to stay in your hotel room anyway!! The continental breakfast was really good, plenty of choices all the way up to closing time. The reception staff were very polite, respectful and helpful. The hotel itself is located just across a busy road (arent they all in Amsterdam!!) from Leidse Square and the bars. We really couldnt find any faults with this hotel. The only thing wrong with Amsterdam are the ridiculous prices that they charge for beer, some bars charge approx Â£10 for a pint and a half of lager.

Reviews.Title: “cold and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner last week. We got it at a good price due to the recession but even having said that, there were lots of bargains available that I wish I had chosen instead. We were really disappointed. We arrived at the hotel at 11am, told we could leave our luggage, but the room was not ready. We went out and came back at 8pm. We were really tired and just wanted to get a quick shower, a little snooze, and then go out. Unfortunately we could not because the room was ABSOLUTELY FREEZING. It was on the ground floor facing the front and 2 walls were sheer glass, then a big window had been left open and the heating was not on. Its February and its Amsterdam. We shut the windoow and put the heating on and got into our bed to try to keep warm. Even when I put my outdoor coat back on, and lay under the thin duvet, I was shivering and nearly crying with the cold. The other big problem was the location of our room. As well as the street noises, we had a constant sound of thump thump thump, bang bang bang.... right outside our room was a wooden staircase which seemed to be in constant use. It was so noisy. Really if they want to have a staircase right next to someones room, get a thick carpet on it! After an hour I went to reception to complain, they brought 2 duvets more, but their attitude was really that we should just wait til the heating warms the room up. Yes, we did that, but it was 10pm before the room was warm and so we ended up going out late because we couldn't dare get in the shower before that, too cold!! So we felt that the hotel had really spoiled our plans for the evening, we didn't get our little snooze due to the cold and noise, so were tired and grumpy... They said they didn't have another room for us. I know its not good for the environment to heat empty rooms... but knowing its a big room, with massive windows, that people are going to stay in it, that its february, it would have been sensible to at least close the windows and put the heating on low during the day. The breakfast was ok, not much choice of bread was left, when I asked a staff member, who had a white roll for her own consumption in her hand, if they had any white rolls left, she said no in a kind of rude way. Good location near Vondelpark and Leiseplein. But I wouldn't stay here again and definately not at the full price.

Reviews.Title: “Three-night accommodation”
Reviews.Author: 1nka
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel,so here are our impressions: -Location: The building is located at a quiet street close to the center of the city,which is convenient.However,it is about 20 minutes on foot away from some of the attractions.On the other hand,this offers the opportunity to the visitor to explore the city. -Rooms: Although the room was kind of small we didn't find it uncomfortable.The bathroom was comfortable as well.In our room there was no bathtub.There was a single window for ventilation.The room was clean. -Staff: Very polite and helpful.All fine. -Services: The room was regularly and efficiently cleaned(despite the fact that we were quite messy...).Breakfast was tasty and of good quality,however,without variety.The central entrance is locked during the night,which makes you feel safe. -Overall impression: Was hard not to smoke inside the building,but this is a general rule in Amsterdam,you have to live with it.We feel the price was proportional to the services offered.Good choice,if you don't mind some walking.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute recommendable accommodations for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Tengs
Reviews.Content: Five norwegian couples visited Amsterdam, a getaway trip without children We found ACH Leidse Square Hotel perfect located. Close to shopping area and restaurants. No traffic noise, but rooms in groundfloor was to close to pavement (drunk noisy tourist on their way home at night) The service was perfect! Nice people working at all positions at the hotel. Breakfast was nice. It took us several ours enjoying the food, in a great area for friendly talks. They had a small hotelbar. With good beer and Irish coffee, friendly staff, we found it quit â€œcosyâ€�. The room had plenty of space. Not sure if they really dedicate rooms for no-smokers. Absolute recommendable accommodations for a fair price

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bristraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located a long walk from the train station, we caught the tram and found the hotel ok. We chose this hotel out of necessity and would have preferred something better located if it was available. The hotel is located in a quiet street. The check-in staff were friendly enough and all spoke English. Like many of the hotels in Europe the expectation was that the keys were left at the front desk, but we had no problems. The room was located on the ground floor and was clean and tidy. The hotel had internet available after paying a small fee and getting log-in details from the check in desk. The walk to the red light district and other tourist areas in Amsterdam was a fair walk, but was do-able. The walk to Leidesplain (where a lot of restaurants, bars and cafes are located) was close, as well as the Van Gogh Museum. On our last day in Amsterdam the hotel held our bags for us in a "secure" room down in the basement. The security was a bit of an unknown as it appeared to be left open some of the time, but we didn't have any security problems as we locked our bags. All in all, this is a budget hotel but was clean and tidy. It wasn't in the best of locations, but it was close to the trams and some bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: vickalaa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the leidseplein area. We have stayed in this area a couple of times, but normally at the Marriot or the NH Amsterdam so we were a bit aprehensive about stopping in a more of a budget hotel....anyhow.... The hotel was really easy to find. We arrived there early and they let us check into 1 of the rooms early, the other one wasn't ready (we had two rooms booked). The 1st room (which turned out to be the other members of our party) had a twin room (pushed together) it was a decent size and the bathroom was clean and tidy with a bath/shower and those little bottles of shampoo/shower gel. The room had a safe and tea/coffee facilities, this must be a new addition as previous reviews have said that they didn't have any. The room also had a tv with plenty of channels. When we got our room, it was a lot smaller than the other one. THis wasn't a problem for us, but there wasn't a lot of room to move around (although we've had a room in the NH Amsterdam that was about the same size and paid a lot more money for it). The bathroom was the same as the other room, was clean and a decent size with a bath/shower. Breakfast was included in the room price and was a continental, it was really nice with a lot of choice of drinks and breads/pastries, yoghurts and a fruit bowl. On checking out, we were able to leave our luggage in a locked room until we needed to leave for our flight. The hotel had a bar but we never used this facitily. THe reception staff were very helpful in any of our questions and would definately return to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the heart of 'Dam'”
Reviews.Author: Away-and-Loving-It
Reviews.Content: Straight to the point - Hotel was very, very nice. Clean, freindly service, excellent location - Just of Leidse Square (which in my opinion is a nicer area than the popular Dam Square, which isn't far away - 20min walk) Leidse Square is a 2-3 min walk from the hotel, but far enough away so it's in a quite area. Leidse Square has dozens on dozens of restaurants and bars, along with main Canal Bus Stops, Road Bus Stops and Tram Stops. Perfect place to start exploring from. Room was small but served the purpose we wanted, i.e. comfortable bed to sleep in, TV, bath and shower. Room also had a safe in it which was helpful. Overall price for the room was a bargain considering you are in a city and it's position. We would definately go back. Perfect little Gem.

Reviews.Title: “best bed ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: mystra
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a lot less than this basically!! We got it very cheap on here (obv. this would depend when you go how long for etc) Anyway it was one of the cheapest ones we could find for the trip in a good area and the time we wanted to go, i think it worked out at about 150 quid for the both of us to stay for 3 nights. We were dropped off by the hotel and actually thought they had dropped us off at the wrong place!! We saw pictures online and just thought that all pictures look a million times better than what its really like. We just hoped for basic and clean and maybe a decent breakfast! it is in a really nice pretty area, near to Leidsplein where there are lots of bars and restaurants, but its not too manic and not noisy at all. The hotel is in a very quiet area across from a canal, tucked away on a quiet side street. i like to party but then i like to sleep so i like to stay somewhere quiet! The room we had, yes it was small by some standards but we found it perfect for us. Some people would see it as small though, but there you go. It was nice and clean, very cosy. Bathroom could have done with a fan though as there was no window and it could get a bit stuffy and erm, smelly haha. The bed...wow...didn't look much but it is the best bed we've ever slept in!!! Most hotels give you 90 million horrible scratchy blankets, but it had a big comfy duvet, was like sleeping in a cloud! better than my bed at home!! The room could get chilly (it was december so yeah it will) so we put the radiator on and it soon warmed up and was cosy and nice! The breakfast was a continental buffet style, lots of choice of bread, cheeses and cold meats, boiled eggs, spreads, tea, coffee, juices. Don't expect full english breakfast, sorry but you're in europe so it may disappoint some but this is what they have on the continent. I love it myself, but it may not be to your taste. Oh yeah, and there was chocolate milkshake, which i loved!! All in all this a really nice hotel for a couple on a tight budget that don't want to stay in a complete dump or miles out. very good value. I don't know what it would be like for other kind of traveler such as families but for a couple like us who are on a budget but want something a bit nice, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the desk staff, they are nasty”
Reviews.Author: LilyWhitest
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very unfriendly and of no help at all. Very testy and ready to 'pick a fight' at any question or request. Like a previous reviewer, I too avoided the desk people at all costs. Why are they working with tourists if they are so disdainful and condescending and unhelpful? Also, the bathtub is about 4 feet off the floor and very slippery and dangerous for children and older adults (or short-legged adults, like myself.) Cleaning staff took away our shampoos instead of replenishing them. And the towels were skimpy and like sandpaper. But, aside from the rude staff, the location was great for the price. Breakfast, by the way: ugh. boiled eggs, cold cuts and the same old same old silos of dry cereal. After a couple of days of the exact same (boring) offerings it seems a waste to even get out of bed for it. Also, beware that some rooms are basement/underground and the staff is pretty snooty about shoving you into them without apology or explanation. The next level is street level and right by the noisy bar and front desk. Again, don't ask to be moved to another room. They act like you are getting the room for free and if you refuse this room they can't get you another. Overall, good budget choice but staff surliness is a real problem. Don't even ask for a map. And expect them to roll their eyes while you are talking. Really.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you're on a budget and not expecting any extras...”
Reviews.Author: Vegan35
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an affordable place to stay near a lot of stuff, this hotel is pretty good. Of course, don't expect any niceties. The staff is a bit unfriendly and rather unhelpful, my mother and I had a couple "run-ins" with them. They seemed to like to argue or talk you around in circles until you just gave up. So, we just avoided them as much as possible! That said, the hotel seemed clean and it was within walking distance of Leidseplein Square, museums (Van Gogh and Rijks), the Hard Rock, the Heineken brewery, Vondel Park, the casino and more. Breakfast came with the room, but it was pretty boring...bread...lots of bread...meat, cheese, eggs, cereal...and it never changed. By the last day, we just skipped it altogether and went out to eat. The only other thing I can think of is the towel situation. They were like sandpaper! And they gave you the bare minimum (2 big towels and 2 hand towels) and very few bath products (basically just soap and shampoo). Overall, though, the price paired with the location made for a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: conduit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Leidse Square for 6 nights. I got quite a good rate as I contacted the hotel directly. The location is really very nice in a quit Amsterdam street, just minutes away from the Leidse plein and public transport. All the museums are walking distance as well as the canals. The rooms are what you expect, everything you need and clean. The staff are great they really make the extra effort. The bar is also a nice place to have a few drinks before hitting the town. Breakfast is free (included in the price) also all you can eat and expect. Really an excellent choice for a good price. Only this hotel doesn't have only one star, I would think three would be a better rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: taylorstl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Amsterdam a few times and this is by far the nicest hotel. The room was very clean and spacious and the breakfast was good. The best thing about this place though, is the location. It is off a suburban side street which makes it very quiet. So quiet infact that you would never know you are a 4 minute walk from Leidsplein and around the corner from Vondel Park. All public transportation is a block away. You never know what you are going to get in Amsterdam, so I was alittle nervous before we arrived but it was great and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: leigha1
Reviews.Content: Ok when we arrived we were checked in within a few mins, reception staff very friendly and extremly helpful. Our room was on the 3rd floor to the back of the hotel. Lift a little slow but not a problem room was quite big with hugh window, tv, twin beds pushed together & safe in the wardrobe ( free of Charge ) bathroom fairly small with Power shower (one of the best I have had) toilet, whb & large mirror - there was also a hair dryer connected to the wall with a plug for a shaver - sachets of shampoo & showergel - shower caps and soap. towels were changed every day we were there. the breakfast was fine- breads, cold meats, cheeses, cereals, fruit, tea, coffee, milk, orange juice, apple juice etc. the bar was small but nice - very friendly staff - open 5pm - 1am It was raining our 2nd day and the hotel loaned us a umberella for as long as we needed it. No smoking but there is a small bench at the front of the hotel beside the ash tray!! only five mins walk from leidseplein square & the tram stop. overall we loved this hotel and will deffinatly return!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah-1975
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, friendly reception staff. Our room was not huge but plently of room for 2, bathroom was an adeqate size aswell and it overlooked the tree lined street which was very nice. Room was very clean. It is situated in a quiet side street but only 5 min walk to the main leidsplein square. From central station catch the no 5, 1 or 2 tram to the square then get of and walk to the hotel. No tea or coffee in the room but you could get it from the bar. The bar area was quite small, but very cosy and welcoming. The breakfast area was a good size and we didnt have to queue for a table and there was plently of choice of hard boiled eggs, cereals, breads, cheese and ham etc. No eggs and bacon but still plenty to eat. There is a lift, but as we were only on the 1st floor we took the stairs. The rooms are very quiet and could hear anyone from any other rooms! This is our 3rd trip to Amsterdam and will definately be going again and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: GNTLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a 3rd party, as I wasn't aware of a major conference going on at the time of my stay and therefore hotel accommodation was very scarce. The location of this hotel is fantastic and overall it is a nice place to stay. The room that my husband and I had was extremely small (I will upload photos shortly). I would even go as far as saying if you are larger than average you would not have fitted in the bathroom. As the room was on the ground floor and looking out into the street we had to keep the curtains closed most of the time as anyone walking past had viewable access into the room. The breakfast was good and there was a decent selection. However, the toaster did break one of the days and they also had no semi skinned or skinned milk or soya alternative for people with a diary intolerance and didn't want to make the effort to acquire any. This hotel would also be unsuitable for people in a wheelchair. I would also recommend pre-booking to get a good rate as we noticed that they were charging a lot for people who turned up without a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a rough start . . .”
Reviews.Author: JimmyH70
Reviews.Content: When we made the reservation - and in subsequent emails - we told the hotel that all we really wanted a quiet room. The first room they gave us turned out to be next to the elevator and right above the bar, which was open until midnight. When we realized that and requested a change, we were informed that since it was after 11 in the morning, the cleaning staff had left so they wouldn't be able to get our room cleaned to re-sell that day and we'd have to stay in it that night. After much insistence on my part, they did give us another room, but it was a twin room, not the double we had reserved, with the advice to try and switch the next day. Not wanting to move again, we ended up staying in the twin room for the 4 nights. It was nothing special and could have used some refurbishing. All that being said, the rest of the stay was very good. The hotel has an excellent location, close to the major museums and public transportation, and the staff was generally very friendly and helpful in providing information. Although the only cooked food for breakfast was boiled eggs, there was a good assortment of items and the food was plentiful. We would stay there again, but would ask to check the room before accepting it.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: abruls
Reviews.Content: I had family over in Amsterdam, I live there myself, visitors I always put up at an hotel. This place has the best location you can wish for. A few minutes walk to the centre of town (canals) in a really nice neighbourhood. Breakfast was included and quite tasty. Rooms were clean and except for the lack of a coffee/tea maker they have everything you need. Staff were very pleasant and give you a really relaxed en welcome feeling. The bar is a nice place to have e few drinks before hitting the town. Best place for e reasonabel price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: carisa23
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at our experience with this quaint hotel which is located in a quiet residential area. An airport shuttle dropped us off right in front so it was very convenient. The staff at the desk were very amiable and our room was spacious. The hotel is walking distance to eateries and a convenience store. Breakfast was good and we felt that what we paid was well worth it. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: EliasRamirez
Reviews.Content: I arrived yesterday form a six day stay in this hotel. Before I did the reservation I looked very carefully at the reviews written down by another people. Most of them were good so I decided to take this hotel instead of another one. Well after being there I must say that is not as good as I expected. Positive points: - It is well located - Breakfast is good Negative points: - Uncomfortable bed, yo can feel the iron stick on your back - Uncomfortable shower, one part of it was low roofed so you can not stand up properly in it - Room cleaning up service. The last two days the did not replace shampoo and soap. Once the replaced bed sheets one of them was broken down. - We did the reservation by lastminute.com and we were not informed that tourist tax was not included in the price and we had to paid it at check-out. I don't know if it is lastminute or hotel fault but take care of it.

Reviews.Title: “Should Be a 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: JTSATLANTA
Reviews.Content: Clean, Non-Smoking, large, central location to everything in Amsterdam and price was reasonable for area. Very friendly and helpful staff with a great sense of humor. Breakfast was go good and included in room rate. Definately recommend this hotel and will stay again on next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on the ACH Leidse Square”
Reviews.Author: txsunshine06
Reviews.Content: Pass on this hotel. The rooms are very small and dingy. We moved to the NH just around the corner and were much happier there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twirlz
Reviews.Content: I booked four nights at this hotel as a birthday surprise for my partner. Not having been to Holland or stayed in a city before I was very nervous about the choice I had made but need not have worried. The room was very clean, comfortably furnished, with cable TV, huge radiator and plenty of very very hot water (much needed as we had torrential rain and got soaked to the skin each day). The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was fantastic. Typical continental syle but loads of choice. The hotel was easy to find and very close to all the sites and I would definately book here again if I was ever to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bansteadfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights last week. The room we had was very clean and comfortable and there was enough room that we weren't tripping over our cases etc. Bathroom was fine and we had air conditioning. We knew from previous reviews that there were no tea and coffee facilities in the room so we took our own -no problem. The hotel has a luggage room to store bags if you arrive too early or need somewhere to store your bags between check out and homeward journey. The breakfast buffet was great -plenty on offer -all help yourself and went on til 10.30 which meant you could have a nice lazy start if you wanted. The reception staff were always helpful and there was always someone on duty. They have the quietest lift we''ve ever come across! The hotel is in the perfect location -a nice quiet residential road but with the main nightlife square just across the road. Very easy access to the trams and buses and right near The Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. The hotel were very good about answering e mails before we left. Rrequest a room not on the ground floor or basement and at the rear of the hotel if possible. Our room had a safe and a hair dryer and air conditioning -worth checking with your booking. We also opted for a non smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Diane-TA
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 double rooms and the difference between the rooms was staggering, from the spacious to the cubby hole, although we all paid the same rate 109 Euros per night bed and breakfast. Due to the poor exchange rate this seemed rather expensive for this class of hotel. The location was great and so was the breakfast buffet. All rooms were clean and some of the staff were friendly. We were able to leave our luggage in a locked room until we were ready to depart. The public transport is excellent and we did not find the walk from the tram to the hotel any problem. The hotel is located behind the Mariott hotel. We ate at Pinocciho's Italian restaurant in Rembrandt Square. the food was delcious but the waiters looked as if they wanted to be elsewhere. We also ate at Hard Rock Cafe by our hotel, The food and service here was terrible and expensive. It seemed that everyone in Amsterdam was smoking, which was unpleasant. Their no smoking in public places ban comes into force on July 1st. We would use the hotel again but ideally the exchange rate needs to improve for us to holiday in Europe again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Location”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: As far as hotels in Amsterdam go, it is a great value. The hotel is clean, provides comfortable accommodations, and is in a great location to get to museums. They provide breakfast and the desk was helpful in guiding us when needed. Their business services were also accommodating. I really have nothing bad to say - it was clean, cheap, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay, esp. Location”
Reviews.Author: Kasturi
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through booking.com, which contains photos and reviews. So we knew pretty much what to expect. Plus points: Decent size double rooms ( at least ours was). Clean sheets and bathroom was also clean. Very near to Liede Square, the centre of night life. So you feel safe a;nd among the crowds. Bit off the main road. so very quiet. You can get a good night;s sleep. Minus: Even for May, the room was very hot, so we had to keep the windows open. So better to book an AC room Sometimes, the bathrooms stink ( probably the drainage problem is common throughout amsterdam) Not very good if you wish to spend much time in Hotel - No room service, dinner not served at nights etc. Overall a good experience; value for money hotel. Clean and the staff were quite helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Doc4
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly staff. While not fancy, the rooms were large and comfortable â€“ particularly the beds. We booked the room with air conditioning, but the windows do allow a nice breeze. The breakfast buffet was good. While near a well-known location (Leidseplein â€“ square), the hotel is on a "side street." That makes it quiet, but somewhat difficult to find as not all the locals know of that street. Very close to trams, so the whole city is easily accessible. One tram ride to the Central Station where one can change to a train to the airport (much cheaper than a cab or shuttle bus!). Close to Van Gogh and Rijks Museums and the cafes, restaurants, and theatres of Leidse Square. I e-mailed the hotel a few times prior to our trip, and they always replied promptly. We used Booking.com which seems to represent a number of Amsterdam hotels. We had originally looked at hotels near Dam Square. While exploring, we found that area to be very busy â€“ fine for sightseeing and shopping, not so wonderful for a quiet night's sleep. There were four in our group, and we all agreed that the Leidse Square hotel was a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmaslow
Reviews.Content: At first my husband and I were a little taken aback - we booked a double bed room and it was minute - so we change to two twin beds pushed together and then the room was decent size - we even had a table and 2 chairs. The staff was really really helpful and everything was very comfortable. The only thing that was not so great was the price - the hotel was in my books pretty expensive - especially for two twin beds pushed together I would for sure recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: UMgirl
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent deal for 5 nights at this hotel. We paid with credit card when we arrived at no extra charge. We were first given a double room which was VERY small. I was not very happy with this room. Since we were staying 4 more nights, I waited until the next afternoon and asked to be moved to a bigger room. They said no problem but I had to wait until the next morning. The next day we were moved to a very large room(twin) with 3 windows, table and chairs, desk and lots of room. So be aware the rooms here vary. The beds were not the best but not the worst. The bathroom was a decent size and the water pressure was good. I found the staff to be attentive and friendly and always around. You had to leave your key when you left each time but it wasn't a problem and I liked the safety feature. At night we never waited more than a min. or 2 to be buzzed in. We had breakfast most mornings, which consisted on coffee, juices, lots of breads, cheese, spreads, cereal and yogurt. Plenty to start your day. Location of hotel was great as well, right next to the Mariott in a quiet neighborhood. Overall at the price we paid we would stay here again as long as we got the bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: allielynn
Reviews.Content: Central location, just two minutes to walk from Leidseplein. Our triple room was very spacious and clean. However, our room was in the basement of the hotel, next to the kitchen and underneath the breakfast room. The noice woke us up at 6 am every morning, which was pretty annoying! So if you book this hotel, be sure that you dont get a room in the basement!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThePhilosopherKing
Reviews.Content: I'd just like to add my own positive review of this hotel to add to the many others. This is an excellent 3 star hotel which is the best I've stayed in in Amsterdam (having been there 5 times). It simply couldn't be any better without adding features that would make it a four star. Location: You just can't fault it. The hotel is very well located in a beautiful, quiet, leafy street which is 2 minutes from the Vondel Park, the Leidseplein and the museums. The hotel: Most hotels in Amsterdam are very tall and narrow buildings which struggle to function as a hotel because of a lack of space. Anyone who has stayed in Amsterdam before will know this. This hotel however is much larger than normal and is the width of 4 buildings together which means that there is ample room for a breakfast room, a bar and a lift which you can get more than 2 people in. The breakfast: A very well organised and well laid out affair with a selection of meats, breads, cheeses, tea, coffee etc. The room and tables are very spacious and you don't feel you are fighting for food as you do in some hotels. The rooms: My room was a decent size and very clean. The hotel photos don't do it justice. The only minor downside was the bathroom which was just a shower and possibly the smallest "smallest room" I've ever seen but then it was clean and did everything I needed it to do. I think other rooms in the hotel are different sizes because the building is over a hundred years old and its upper floors use the attic space. I saw two rooms when I was there and both were fine. The staff: Helpful and courteous at the front desk; invisible and efficient everywhere else: just the way I like it. I think this hotel is well worth its price and if you are staying 2 or 3 days for some sightseeing then look no further. If you want a wild, hash fuelled party then go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JeanneAlbi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. The rooms were spacious, quiet and breakfast was excellent. The location is superb, minutes from Leidseplein, but in a quiet residential location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the deal it seems...”
Reviews.Author: drzen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last June and the hotel seemed pretty okay. Our recent stay, however, was not that great. The rates ranged from 119 to 69 Euros during our stay, which was competitive for Amsterdam. The first room we were in had a double bed. However, the mattress was so bad that a spring was protruding and made the night not very pleasant. We changed rooms the next day, but had 2 single beds pushed together. Not very romantic! We found these mattresses not much better. I would never consider buying a mattress of such low quality for myself. This hotel management does not seem to understand the importance of a comfortable bed for it's guests! The hotel is essentially a tourist hotel (tour groups). Breakfasts were such a nightmare with crowds of avaricious tourists, that we ended up skipping some breakfasts and eating outside the hotel. It was disgusting watching some of the tourists. One morning, two guys split the equivalent of a full loaf of bread between themselves. The housekeeping staff were fine. The desk clerks varied from helpful and friendly to a couple of curt staff. We originally had 2 separate reservations, which were collapsed into 1 reservation and then during check-out the clerk tried to charge us 10 Euro (per night) extra for our last two nights than the amount listed on our reservation. She did make the change, but had we not checked the bill, we would have paid more than we should have. I won't stay here again...there are better deals to be had with more comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - awful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nick30_2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent - great breakfast, tidy and clean rooms. However, we did have problems with the cleaners. Our door was once left open by the cleaners for approx. 7 hours. The receptionist just asked if something was stolen, but didn't offer an apology. When leaving, our bill didn't sum up to what we expected, therefore we wanted to have some time to double-check. The recepionist (another one) became unfriendly and prompted me to pay. After leaving the hotel I checked the bill again and we had been charged a wrong nightly rate - charging us over 100 Euro more. The receptionist then argued that the website through which we had booked sounded 'odd' (the website was easytobook). She then finally agreed to cancel the previous payment. Therefore 'never again'

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: HolidayKel
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based mostly on the reviews that I had read on trip advisor and we werent disappointed! My boyfriend and i travel a lot and have become reliant on this website before making a final decision about accommodation. Leidse Square hotel is a great little treasure in a brilliant location. Only a few mins walk from the wonderful bars, restaurants and shopping of Leidse Sq itself, the hotel is tucked away in a quiet residential area and surrounded by a number of other boutique style establishments. The rooms are basic but very clean and tidy and contain everything you need when staying away from home (ie: comfortable bed, powerful shower and pleasant surrounding). The staff were friendly and helpful and allowed us to leave our bags in a secure area until our room was ready. Amsterdam is amazing and I cant wait to go back! the beautiful canals, cobbled streets and flower markets are great for just browsing and taking in the sights. We sampled a number of bards and restuarants that were all of a high standard and very reasonably priced. We visited the red light district in the evening but were quite disappointed and felt it is over rated and will quite happily visit Amsterdam again and not venture in to this area of the city. Overall a great place for a weekend break and I will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: terracotta_army
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 2007. Stayed in a standard double room. Room was reasonable size and both room and bathroom were clean and comforatable. Staff were fairly friendly. The complimentary breakfast was verynice - good choice of food with Dutch cheeses also available! Location was great - on a quiet street but only a minutes walk to busy Liedsplein and then on towards the main sights. So not far from the thick of things. Probably about 40 minutes walk back up to the train station. In all, a good hotel for the money and probably would stay there again if we ever returned to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: maryocCork
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location, just around the corner from leidse square, which has lots of bars and night life. I really liked the staff and found them very friendly and helpful, Beware of bag stealers in the bars though, 2 of our gang of 10 had handbags stolen from their chairs...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jerseymick
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night on route to Berlin, I have been to Amsterdam a few times and always try and book a different hotel each time in other parts of town. I was quite impressed with the location of this hotel, I like it around the Vondel park and museum plein, good chilling spots. The hotel was clean and the rooms were clean and tidy, Never had breakfast I prefer the little Dutch bakeries for a later breakfast. Location is important to me when booking a city hotel and with the help of tripadvisor you can usually get the right balance with location and cleanliness and this hotel falls into that category for me.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: msjolie
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel twice and would highly recommend it. It's near the interesting Leidse Square but in a quiet location .. Tram stop nearby and lots of attractions within walking distance (comfortable shoes necessary for the cobblestones!) The hotel is clean and bright. We requested AC and got it each time. The continental breakfast was good. The staff were really helpful and friendly. The hotel is also on theairport shuttle bus route. Would stay here again ......

Reviews.Title: “Leidse Square hotel was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: OldManCuba
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights in mid-July at the Leidse Square hotel, in a standard double room. The room was clean, modern, relatively spacious, and quite well-furnished. We were impressed by the high ceilings and big windows. Even the elevator was large enough to fit two suitcases as well as the two of us, which is unusual for small-ish European hotels...I mean, those that even have an elevator. The hotel staff were helpful and quite friendly, and you can't beat the location: on a quiet street, but just a three minute walk from the Leidseplein, and about the same distance to the Vondelpark. It was very easy to get anywhere in the city by tram or on foot (plus you could rent bicycles nearby). Just be careful crossing the streets - the pedestrian crosswalks can be quite confusing, especially when you're jetlagged. The Museumplein was also very close. The breakfast (included) was basic but filling: toast, buns, cheese, hardboiled egss, cereals etc. We have no complaints about this hotel, and in fact we have no problem recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ACH Leidse”
Reviews.Author: Pfss
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights in a superior top floor room at the Leidse Square and found it to be a great Hotel. Location was good, 5 mins walk to Museums, VonDel Park, and Leidse plein square which was perfect for us.Lovely , large top floor room, A/C, lovely bathroom, and 3 windows looking over different views of Amsterdam. The only downside was lack of hospitality tray, but as i knew that when I booked, I took a travel kettle and suplies with me so I could enjoy my early morning cuppa. As we were driving, we parked at the Olympisch Stadion P&R, you get up to 2 return tram tickets to the centre.and that ensures you get parking at a rate of 5.50 euros per 24 hour period up to a maximum of 96 hours. What a bargain!! We got Tram 16 to the Concert Hall and it was then about 10 minutes walk to Hotel.Tha tram driver even gave us a map and explained which way to go. We walked eveywhere, and found it really easy to get across town from this hotel, without getting worn out. I would definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone who appreciates being close to the action, but just far enough away to get a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Noelsy
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel from Trip Advisor and was pleasantly surprised. The Room was up under the roof at the back and very quiet and recently decorated. The only complaint was no shower curtin so the floor got messy. Like most hotels in Amsterdam it had lots of stairs and no porters. The staff at reception were very helpful, cheerful and know the city. The bar tender was also very helpful, cheerful and good company. Breakfast was good but the only hot food was boiled eggs. We enjoyed Amsterdam and used the maps supplied by hotel and the Metro and found the city very friendly and enjoyable and will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: vanderwal
Reviews.Content: I was moved to this hotel from one of its sister hotels that had over booked. I was there during a heatwave and on the top floor (no air conditioning), but aside from the heat it was a really enjoyable hotel.
